question: A country becomes more interesting and develops more quickly when its population includes a mixture of nationalities.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is belived that countries are developing faster and become more inspiring when their populations consist of variety of people with different nationalities. In my opinion, it is very controversial question, but I believe that nations who are tolerant to others and friendly are able to succeed in constracting better world not only for themselves and their surroundings but also for future generations. In this essay, I will discuss both points of view about attractiveness and development of countries based on national diversity.On the one hand, people of different nationalities are hardly able to understand each other and can be impatient for people who have another nationalities, that can create difficulties in communication, making agreements, sovling of problems. For example, people with different backgrounds can strat arguing about better governmental constitutions and politics, religions, educational system, traditional and another types of medicine, and so on. It worths to mention that none of those people will be completely right, if they deside to show off their experience instead of accepting ideas of others and just giving advice. Moreover, some disputes can even lead to quarrels, but not to finding the better dessisions, that can influence on safety of people with different nationalities. So, for living peacefully and sharing some ideas of better developmental practice, people should first of all respect each other independantly of their nantionalities.On the other hand, people of various nationalities are able to create not only interesting and diverse community, but also share knowlege and experience in order to achieve the best results in countries' development. For achieving this, people should follow several basic rules, which are usually unwritten, but those mental and behavioral lows should be understood by everyone. Firstly, they should be tolerant to each other and accepting some differences. Secondly, they should be polite when they want to share their knowlege and experiences, not showing off. Thirdly, it would be wonderful if they are able to create international community where people can communicate and make friends. Last but not least, they should remember that their attitudes for each other influence on the world as a whole where they and their children live, so they should be responsible for their words and behavior.In conclusion, countries which managed to connect people of different nationalities and create a friendly surroundings, in my opinion, are able to develope faster and look like fascinating diverse community which consist of people of various backgrounds.
llm: The idea that a nation's appeal and development are enhanced by a blend of cultures is a topic of considerable debate. I strongly believe that a diverse population significantly contributes to a country's progress and intrigue.On one hand, a multicultural society combines a variety of perspectives, ideas, and experiences, fostering innovation and advancement. A notable example is the United States, which has flourished due to its diversity. The arrival of immigrants from multiple backgrounds has fueled technological innovations, enriched its culture, and boosted its economy. This variety has positioned the US as a global center for business, education, and tourism, accelerating its overall development.Conversely, a mix of nationalities promotes creativity, tolerance, and mutual understanding among citizens. Countries like Canada and Australia, with a high proportion of foreign-born residents, exemplify strong community bonds and social cohesion. Their diverse populations have cultivated an openness to new ideas, which has been instrumental in their economic and social progress.However, it is crucial to recognize that diversity can also bring challenges, such as integration and language barriers. Yet, with appropriate management and policies, these hurdles can be addressed, allowing the advantages of diversity to flourish.In summary, I believe that countries with a blend of nationalities tend to be more vibrant and develop more rapidly. The interaction of ideas, cultures, and experiences within a multicultural society can propel innovation, creativity, and growth, ultimately enhancing the country’s prosperity.

question: Advertising affects what people think is important and has a negative effect on their lives (agree/disagree)
human: Today people are surrounded by advertising. This affects what people think is important and has a negative impact on people’s lives. To what extent do you agree or disagree?With the advent of the Internet, advertisements, originally displayed only on TV, billboards, posters and so on, are becoming increasingly ubiquitous and commonplace for the general public. In my view, this kind of impact could be both crucial and, on a certain level, detrimental.On the one hand, this phenomenon could denote that although we have already had a diverse range of , people are still capable of inventing innovative approaches catering for all kinds of requirements of advertising. It is a symbol that demonstrates the creativity rooted in human beings. Apart from that, it also represents that the speed of spreading information is conspicuously escalating. More purposeful is, therefore, the fact that, besides booming of the advertising, it constitutes a major reason why people could be so prosperous in this digital age.On the other hand, there are various unpleasant consequences as well. Firstly, with the omnipresent , it could potentially cause people to do impulsive shopping. Secondly, the , if regulated in a mismanaged , could make people constantly feel uncomfortable or annoyed. In this sense, instead of being an instrumental tool to promote amenities, advertisements could be considered a hindrance when people are frequently blocked by them. Furthermore, it would cost one precious time to have to sift the helpful ad from a host of others.In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, advertising is a beneficial phenomenon for all with a number of insignificant drawbacks. I believe that in the future we can improve the way advertising is done at present, and embrace the positive influence of advertising even further in the long run.This essay is another example of what Band 8 writing may look like. It’s weak point is that the author goes slightly off-topic while trying to discuss whether advertising affects what people view as important and instead talks about the reason advertising is spreading and about human creativity. However, the other part of task type (negative effects of advertising) is covered well, the ideas are well-developed and supported. There is a clear logical flow of information and a range of transitional words is used appropriately to sequence ideas. The way author uses synonyms to rephrase the task topic in the intro paragraph demonstrates their lexical skill, which is also evident in other parts of this essay. There are many complex sentences and very few errors. Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.0.
llm: I believe that advertising plays a significant role in shaping people's perceptions of what matters, often leading to negative consequences in their lives. It has woven itself into the fabric of our everyday experiences, swaying our thoughts, emotions, and actions. Through a multitude of platforms such as social media, television, and billboards, advertisements mold our understanding of what is desirable, essential, and valuable.A key way that advertising influences our lives is by setting unrealistic standards and encouraging materialism. Advertisements frequently depict idealized and unachievable lifestyles, leaving viewers feeling dissatisfied and inadequate. This can trigger a relentless quest for consumer goods, resulting in financial strain, debt, and diminished overall well-being. Additionally, the continuous onslaught of ads can foster anxiety and lower self-esteem, as people feel compelled to align themselves with societal expectations and norms.Furthermore, advertising has the power to skew people's values and priorities, diverting their attention from what genuinely holds significance in life. By prioritizing physical appearance, wealth, and social status, advertisements can redirect focus from more meaningful pursuits such as relationships, personal development, and contributions to the community. This can create a sense of disconnection and confusion as individuals become increasingly fixated on external approval and material possessions, rather than cultivating internal satisfaction and staying true to their core values.In summary, advertising profoundly influences our perceptions of importance and can detrimentally affect our lives. By fostering materialistic attitudes, setting unrealistic aspirations, and manipulating core values, advertisements can lead to increased anxiety, decreased well-being, and disorientation. It is crucial for individuals to cultivate a critical perspective on the impact of advertising and to nurture a more genuine and balanced understanding of what truly matters in life.

question: Advertising is all around us, it is an unavoidable part of everyone’s life. Some people say that advertising is a positive part of our lives while others say it is a negative one. Discuss both views and include your own opinion. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience. You should write at least 250 words.
human: Many people wonder about . Some people think that it has negative impact in our life. However, positive effect on this world.? Of Course for several reasons: firstly, it motivates the psychological point in everyone, and women in particular. They will run to buy this advertised product especially if it’s from , just to show their beauty to men, which may lead to negative effects of too much sexual attention. Secondly, you can sit comfortably with your family and suddenly the telephone is ringing, but it’s nothing important, it’s just another company to convince you to buy one of their products. It is a real . Lastly, sometimes you do not have the financial ability to buy something, but with these new methods of advertisement, you run to buy it, which affect your budget.On the other hand, there are some good sides to advertising. For instance, it compares the prices of many companies which the consumer. Besides, it really see more products which we unless the TV or Radio advertised them. , it breaks our daily routine and allows us to see new faces and learn the language better with the help of the daily updates they deliver through .In conclusion, as we can see there are many aspects to this . I feel that we gain no benefits at all from advertisement, it plays buy more things that they do not need it at all.
llm: Advertising plays a fundamental role in our everyday experiences, and its effects continue to spark discussion. On one hand, many argue that advertising has a beneficial impact on our lives. Proponents suggest that it keeps us informed about new products, services, and ideas, which can enhance our quality of life and expand our options. For instance, advertisements for essential medications and public health campaigns can raise awareness about diseases and preventative measures. Furthermore, advertising can promote cultural and social principles, such as equality and environmental stewardship, through compelling and thought-provoking content.Conversely, some people view advertising as a detrimental force. They argue that it manipulates consumers into purchasing unnecessary items, instills unrealistic expectations, and fosters a culture of materialism. Additionally, advertising can sometimes be misleading, leading individuals to make poor choices. For example, certain advertisements for food items and cosmetics often make exaggerated claims or showcase unrealistic imagery, potentially harming consumers. Advertising can also be intrusive and irritating, manifesting as spam emails, pop-up ads, or loud commercials that interrupt our daily lives and create annoyance.In my view, advertising has both positive and negative aspects, largely dependent on its execution. While it can deliver valuable information and champion important causes, it can also be deceptive and coercive. For advertising to be a constructive element in our lives, companies and advertisers need to embrace honesty, transparency, and social responsibility. They should aim to produce advertisements that are informative, engaging, and considerate of consumers' time and intellect. Through this approach, advertising can serve as a powerful tool for educating and empowering individuals, rather than a source of irritation. Ultimately, it is our responsibility as consumers to critically assess advertisements and make knowledgeable choices regarding the products and services we endorse.

question: Boxing is a blood sport which often results in physical injury. It is inappropriate for this sport to exist in the modern age.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: There is debatable issue as to whether boxing, a seemingly bloody sport, should be excluded from the modern society. As far as I am concerned, the attempt to remove boxing from the current age is utterly unjustified.Admittedly, boxing is often associated with various disturbing factors, such as foul language, disregard to rivals, violent punches and inelegant appearance as a result of intense physical contacts. However, such gory scenes may frequently take place in underground boxing games which are barely recognised by the professional community of boxing and by the legal system. Unlike underground boxing, professional boxing upholds moral principles and universal values, for examples, respect to opponents, obedience of rules, etc. Also, professional boxers are protected by safety equipment and judges who may stop the game when witnessing any player suffering serious injuries. Therefore, the health hazards involved in boxing games may not be as severe as the public assumes.Another reason reinforcing my position is that boxing already enjoys considerable popularity around the world and plays an important part in people's entertainment, as exemplified by the successful ticket sales of most boxing games and high audience rating of TV programmes broadcasting boxing matches. Given such popularity of boxing, the removal of this sport may cause widespread dissatisfaction and complaint.To draw a conclusion, the exclusion of boxing is completely groundless and irrational, given the safety protection, sportmanship and popularity as reflected in this sport. I expect in the future, more views could arise to furnish the understanding in this regard.
llm: The presence of boxing as a sport in today's society has sparked considerable debate, with some claiming it is a blood sport that should not exist in the modern world. While it is undeniable that boxing can lead to physical injuries, I contend that there is a valid place for the sport.One of the main arguments in favor of boxing is that, like any contact sport, it involves risks that participants willingly accept. Boxers engage in extensive training and preparation to reduce the possibility of injury, and various safety measures, such as mandatory medical evaluations and the use of protective gear, are implemented to safeguard their health. Furthermore, many athletes and boxing organizations prioritize participant safety, promoting responsible and safe practices within the sport.Another point against the notion of banning boxing is the potential advantages it offers. The sport can serve as an influential means for social mobility and personal growth, particularly for youth from marginalized backgrounds. It instills discipline, perseverance, and resilience—qualities that are essential in life. Take, for instance, the case of renowned boxer Manny Pacquiao, who emerged from poverty to achieve world champion status, exemplifying the transformative impact of boxing.Additionally, it is important to recognize that boxing has progressed over time, with improved medical care and safety protocols significantly lowering the risks of severe injury. The sport also boasts a rich cultural and historical significance, with many viewing it as an art form that demands skill, strategy, and athletic prowess.In summary, despite the inherent risks associated with boxing, I believe it can thrive in contemporary society when proper safety measures, regulations, and a culture of responsibility are upheld. The benefits it provides, particularly in terms of personal development and social mobility, as well as its cultural relevance, outweigh the arguments for its elimination.

question: Boys are most influenced by their fathers and girls are most influenced by their mothers. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons to support your opinion.
human: It is true that nowadays have a great influence children. Some people hold the opinion that the same sex is the major determination of influencing parent, but others . As far as I am concerned, . My arguments for this point are listed below.First of all, a father is the person who have already passed ways his son is passing now, in other words, sons are following their father’s footsteps. , based on experience it is easy for a father to notice his sons’ drawbacks and to influence them.Secondly, it is true that a boy is , a girl is a subtle and fragile one. It is hard for mothers to influence their sons, because it is not likely that can affect a strong one.In conclusion, it seems to me unfair that boys are most influenced by their mothers. Based on at least two points above I strongly agree that children are influenced by a parent of the same gender.
llm: The belief that boys are primarily shaped by their fathers and girls by their mothers is a prevalent stereotype. Nonetheless, I challenge this perspective. While it is evident that parents significantly influence their children's development, categorizing this influence strictly by gender is an oversimplification.In truth, both mothers and fathers can make substantial impacts on their children, irrespective of gender. Children often view both parents as role models, absorbing lessons from their values, experiences, and behaviors. For example, a boy might gain insights on emotional intelligence and empathy from his mother, while a girl might learn about resilience and self-reliance from her father. Additionally, in many families, childcare responsibilities are shared, which means both parents offer equal support and guidance, complicating the idea of a singular primary influence.Moreover, research indicates that a child's development is affected by a complex interplay of factors, including family dynamics, social environments, and individual temperaments. The parent-child relationship is unique to each family and can be influenced by elements such as parental engagement, communication styles, and conflict management. Thus, it is unrealistic to assume that boys are exclusively influenced by their fathers and girls by their mothers.In summary, although parents undoubtedly play a vital role in their children's development, this influence does not align neatly with gender. Both mothers and fathers can significantly affect their children, and the nature of that influence is intricate and varied. It is crucial to acknowledge and embrace the diversity of family relationships and the different ways in which parents contribute to their children's growth and development.

question: Changing drivers age limits is the best way to reduce traffic accidents (from Target Band
human: This essay was written on a topic from “Target Band 7” book (page 54, reprinted with permission).You should spend about 40 minutes on this taskThe best way to reduce traffic accidents is to raise the age limit for younger drivers and to lower the age limit for elderly ones. Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your experience.Write at least 250 wordsIn today’s world the number of traffic accidents is constantly rising as well as the number of injuries and deaths they cause. A better regulative approach is required traffic accidents can be reduced. Some people say that changing the drivers’ age limits is the best solution to the problem. However, there are other, more practical ways to deal with this problem.One alternative is imposing heavier fines the drivers who exceed the permitted alcohol consumption. According to recent , a great proportion of traffic accidents has alcohol as its reason. Utilising technology and installing devices that detect drunk drivers and lock car ignition can be used to keep people with track record of drunk driving off the roads. On some occasions and for repeat offenders in particular, a prison sentence may also be considered.Furthermore, people should be better educated and more careful while behind the wheel. To be more specific, people should learn to obey road rules and respect the other drivers instead of causing tension or submitting to road rage. In addition, heavy fines should also be levied for exceeded speed limits. Last but not least, safer and wider roads should be constructed to make for easier and more comfortable driving.Tightening age limits for drivers can be a complementary approach. For example, the elderly with vision problems or other important health issues should be excluded from driving. Besides, young people under 18 years old are considered immature to drive. However, maturity does not necessarily always increases with one’s age, which is why other measures are needed dangerous driving.In conclusion, I believe that stronger measures should be implemented for the prevention of traffic accidents, and drivers should have a more responsible attitude. Setting age limits could be helpful but should not be considered the optimal and only solution to the problem.The writer’s position is clear throughout the essay. There is a logical organisation of information and effective use of paragraphing. The range of vocabulary is wide enough for the student to show flexibility and accuracy of expression. Overall, the control of grammar and punctuation is good, with only a few errors made. The essay is up to the mark and is likely to get Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: The idea of changing age restrictions for drivers as a strategy to decrease traffic accidents has ignited significant controversy. While some believe that adjusting the age limits could effectively reduce road incidents, the situation is much more nuanced.On one side, raising the driving age might reduce accidents linked to inexperienced young drivers. Research shows that novice drivers, especially teenagers, are more susceptible to accidents due to their limited experience and propensity for risky behavior. By increasing the legal driving age, the frequency of accidents involving this group could indeed diminish.However, this approach is overly simplistic and fails to tackle the underlying causes of traffic incidents. Factors such as inadequate road conditions, vehicle upkeep, and reckless driving behaviors across all age demographics play substantial roles in accident rates. Additionally, changing the age limit could inadvertently lead to an increase in unlicensed driving among young people, thereby heightening the risk of accidents.A more thorough solution would require improvements in driver education, enhancement of road infrastructure, and enforcement of stricter traffic regulations. This comprehensive strategy would not only lower accident rates among young drivers but also address the wider issue of road safety. Implementing a graduated licensing system that gradually introduces driving privileges would also allow new drivers to accumulate experience in a controlled environment.In summary, while modifying the driving age limit may offer some advantages, it is not the most effective or practical solution for reducing traffic accidents. A holistic strategy that focuses on the root causes of accidents and fosters a culture of safe driving among all road users is essential. By adopting such an approach, we can work towards safer roads for everyone, irrespective of age.

question: Childcare training courses should be mandatory for all parents (agree/disagree)
human: Childcare training courses should be mandatory for all parents. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your own opinion and include relevant examples.It is true that parents need some knowledge and experience in order to raise their in an appropriate way. In this regard, many families attend different training courses. While I agree that these courses might be useful for some of them, I totally disagree with the recommended obligatory of such training.On the one hand, training courses usually offered by governments could be very useful for those guardians who have a with special needs. For example, if a child has a birth defect or has been diagnosed with any mental or musculoskeletal disorders, these kinds of training could be lifesaving. Additionally, as we know, the first few months after birth are really a crucial period of a child’s life; parents should obtain different information related to their child’s vaccinations, common health problems, different developmental issues and so on, which can be delivered through such training courses.On the other hand, I believe that making these programs a mandatory option would cause several problems for societies and individuals as well. To begin with, in order to achieve this goal, many professionals should be trained which may not be affordable for some governments. From an individual’s point of view, this kind of programs could be very time-consuming for some families who have other at home or who work long hours. The other important consideration is that parent training courses may not provide all the necessary information for each and every family. To be more specific, parents could get more beneficial information through different websites such as YouTube according to their own preferences.In conclusion, although I believe that many families can take advantage training courses, I do believe that making them a compulsory option for everyone is too time and money-consuming for individuals and governments.The introduction is very good and relevant. The writer’s position is balanced, relevantly and properly developed in two body paragraphs. The conclusion summarizes both sides of the argument and logically finished the essay. To maintain the necessary level of formality the word ‘kids’ should be replaced with ‘children’ everywhere in this essay. The use of prepositions needs more attention as some are inappropriate or incorrect. The length could be reduced – it’s not necessary to write a very long essay to get a higher score, and often it is better to write a shorter essay (no shorter than 250 words though!) but spend more time proofreading, correcting errors and improving the quality of writing. Overall this essay is likely to score Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: I believe that making childcare training courses mandatory for all parents is not the right approach. While parenting is undoubtedly a crucial responsibility and equipping parents with relevant skills can be advantageous, there are compelling reasons to consider the potential drawbacks of compulsory courses.Firstly, enforcing childcare training could be seen as an unwarranted intrusion by the government into private family matters. Parenting is an incredibly personal journey, and strategies that work for one family may not be suitable for another. A universal approach could foster resentment and hinder participation.Secondly, not every parent would need or gain from these training programs. Many already possess the skills and knowledge necessary for effective childcare through their experiences or inherent capabilities. Furthermore, the quality and focus of these courses may vary widely, which could result in inconsistent outcomes.Additionally, requiring childcare training raises practical issues like accessibility and affordability, potentially adding stress to new parents who may already feel overwhelmed. It might also unintentionally marginalize those who struggle with childcare demands, leading to diminished self-esteem and confidence in their parenting skills.Instead of enforcing mandatory training, it would be more effective to ensure that such courses are available and accessible on a voluntary basis for those who would find them beneficial. This approach respects parents' independence while still offering support and resources to those seeking assistance. By fostering a culture of voluntary growth and support rather than imposing blanket requirements, we can create a community that values and uplifts all parents in their unique parenting experiences.

question: Children should be engaged in paid work, agree or disagree?
human: In many countries children are engaged in different kinds of paid work. Some people regard this as completely wrong, while others consider it a valuable work experience, important for learning and taking responsibility. What is your opinion?The issue of whether or not children should be engaged in some paid work has sparked a heated debate. While some argue that having some employment experience is conducive to a child’s learning and development, I contend that it would bring harm to the child’s and learning.First of all, a workplace designed for adults normally child-friendly facilities. Desks and chairs are too high for a child; the light switches are installed on the walls unreachable children; also emergency training and facilities such as phones are only provided to adults. Furthermore, various hazards such as polluted air and chemical fumes are still produced in factories and farms. Undoubtedly young people would suffer in such workplaces.Also, children would find it frustrating when they are not properly inducted before starting a job. A child working in a cement factory would feel a setback when he could not get immediate support while struggling with the procedures of recording different raw materials that required by the job. Further, without sufficient support, a child’s misunderstanding or inappropriately communicating with adults would only disappoint him and prevents him from active learning and interacting with other people.To conclude, a child’s paid employment experience would lead to a negative impact on their health and active learning. However, recognizing the importance of children’s learning and their awareness of responsibility, it is advisable to encourage them to be involved in some volunteering opportunities where they can meaningfully learn and interact with other people with sufficient care and support in place for such jobs.This is a good essay. There are only a few errors (mouse over the words underlined in blue shows corrections), but otherwise this work seems worthy of Band 7.5 or 8. Remember to always proofread your essay before submitting it. Keep up the good work!
llm: The idea of involving children in paid work is a contentious issue. While some believe it can offer valuable skills and foster financial independence, I firmly oppose this viewpoint. The involvement of children in paid employment can have significant negative impacts on their physical, emotional, and educational well-being.To begin with, children’s main responsibility should be their education. Paid work can serve as a distraction, hindering their academic performance and depriving them of essential knowledge. Additionally, the physical and mental stresses associated with paid jobs can pose serious risks to their health and overall development. Children are in a crucial phase of growth and require ample time for play, rest, and engaging in activities that support both their physical and emotional well-being.Moreover, there is a risk that paid work can expose children to exploitation and abuse. In the absence of strict regulations and protections, children may find themselves working in unsafe environments, enduring long hours for very little compensation. Such experiences can result in lasting physical and emotional harm, ultimately stunting their ability to reach their potential. Furthermore, early engagement in paid work can rob children of their childhood—a vital stage for developing identity, social skills, and emotional intelligence.Rather than allowing children to take on paid jobs, we should emphasize opportunities that encourage skill development, volunteerism, and extracurricular activities that enhance their physical, emotional, and educational growth. These alternatives can help them gain essential life skills, boost their confidence and self-esteem, and prepare them for adulthood without compromising their childhood experiences. In summary, involving children in paid work is neither appropriate nor advantageous; we must prioritize their education, health, and overall well-being over any potential financial benefits.

question: Children these days are suffering from obesity, why and how can it be solved?
human: Modern children are suffering from the diseases that were once considered to be meant for adults only. Obesity is a major disease prevalent among children. What are its causes and what solutions can be offered?Nowadays, the increasing rate of overweight children and adults is a worldwide health issue. Obesity is a major problem which is increasing day by day in children. There are various reasons behind it. This essay will discuss the causes of obesity and offer some solutions.The first cause of obesity is junk food. It is often seen that mostly children are fond of burgers, pizzas, noodles and . These types of foods are easily available to them in school canteens. Children love to purchase chips, , ice-cream for lunch. Moreover, in this modern era, parents are working and they do not have time to cook at home. Parents often buy dinner for their children instead of preparing food at home. This calorie-rich diet is making children obese. This problem can be solved by teaching children to cook healthy foods for themselves and banning junk foods and fizzy drinks in schools. This diet can be replaced by milk, juice and fruits for lunch.The second cause of obesity is . It is true that the use of computers and television is increasing children. They spend most of their time watching television or playing video games on a computer. This technological advancement has reduced the level of physical activity in this specific age group. This issue can be resolved by encouraging children to do physical exercises. Parents can take their children to park to encourage playing with friends. Furthermore, schools can add sports in their curriculum to maintain physical fitness in their students.To sum up, it is clear that main causes of obesity are unhealthy eating and not enough physical activities. This ailment can be prevented and treated by healthy eating and physical exercises.This is a good essay. There are only a few minor errors that could have been easily prevented by proofreading this essay one last time before submission (mouse over the words underlined in blue shows corrections). Overall, this work seems worthy of IELTS Band 8. Keep up the good work!
llm: The increasing rate of obesity in children has become a significant global issue. Recent research indicates that the incidence of obesity among children has surged, with about one in five youngsters classified as overweight or obese. This troubling development is linked to various contributing factors, including sedentary behaviors, poor dietary choices, and insufficient physical activity.A major factor contributing to childhood obesity is the rising intake of junk food and sugary beverages. Many children are attracted to convenient, high-calorie processed foods, which are not only abundant but also heavily marketed to them. Additionally, the widespread use of screens—such as televisions, computers, and smartphones—has resulted in reduced physical activity as children increasingly engage in sedentary pastimes.Addressing this issue requires a collaborative strategy. First and foremost, parents and guardians must take an active role in fostering healthy eating habits and promoting physical activity among their children. This can involve preparing nutritious meals, limiting screen time, and encouraging participation in outdoor play and sports. Schools also have a crucial part to play by integrating physical education and wellness courses into their programs, while providing nutritious meal options in their cafeterias.Furthermore, government officials and lawmakers must act by establishing policies that encourage healthier lifestyles, such as increasing support for physical education initiatives and regulating the marketing of unhealthy foods to children. Community programs, including the development of parks and recreational areas, can also enhance opportunities for physical activity. By collaborating on these efforts, we can work to decrease the rates of childhood obesity and pave the way for healthier, more active generations. Ultimately, it is our shared duty to tackle this urgent issue and equip children with the tools for a healthy and joyful life.

question: Competitiveness is a positive quality for people in most societies. How does competitiveness affect individuals? Is it a positive or negative trend?
human: Life is full of competition. Soon after the release from competitive university exams, the hard fighting for higher positions in a company will be waiting for you. While the competitiveness has been bringing us a convenient society, no small number of employments have been tired of never-ending competitions. No doubt about a positive effect on societies, but when we start to argue about the effect on individuals, it becomes more controversial. This essay will argue the drawbacks of competitiveness for individuals, especially from the perspective of Japanese modern society and typical Japanese office workers. I believe that cooperativeness and uniqueness are sometimes more important attitude than competitiveness.Firstly, competitiveness causes less diversity. If there is a competition, there must be the same evaluation metrics to differentiate winners and losers. The evaluation procedure needs to limit the metrics into specific aspects of the human being. Therefore, it is extremely difficult to prove that the metrics are proper for all of the possible cases and effective for the HR evaluation. For example, Japanese companies are likely to judge quantitatively based on the numbers related to performance. However, how can we evaluate the cooperativity or the non-quantitative performance like in creative jobs? Most Japanese companies adopted the HR evaluation methods based on average working hours per day and number of reports monthly. That’s why the Japanese tend to overwork to fulfill this requirement. In addition, as a result of placing more importance in quantity of reports, rather than quality, Japanese employees are prone to choose easy and short-term tasks or outsourcing instead of building by their own methods. This tendency causes fewer complicated and long-term tasks.Secondly, competitiveness causes less cooperativeness. Fewer people volunteer to play a disadvantageous role for smooth teamwork. Moreover, some people play an evil role by blaming or cheating the competitors in order to be superior to them. As a consequence, overall efficiency will decline and some people will be overestimated. Even if there are no problems temporarily, the long-lasting large companies will eventually become corrupt, and those who have the most political power, rather than real power, will remain at the top.Consequently, competitiveness is the basis of capitalism which brings us a brighter and more convenient society, however, biased evaluation and less cooperative working environment possibly drive people into nervous breakdowns. Karoshi, overwork death derived from too much stress and less sleeping, is one of the most serious social problems in Japan. We may need to rethink about the competitiveness.
llm: In many cultures, competitiveness is regarded as a highly valuable trait that motivates individuals to pursue excellence and extend their capabilities. The effects of competitiveness on individuals are complex, yielding both beneficial and detrimental outcomes. On one side, it cultivates a strong work ethic, inspires people to accomplish their goals, and boosts self-esteem. It drives innovation, encourages risk-taking, and builds resilience—critical skills for success in various life domains.Additionally, a competitive atmosphere can stimulate healthy rivalries, enabling individuals to learn from one another's strengths and weaknesses while developing strategies for self-improvement. This can facilitate personal growth, enhance performance, and foster a sense of achievement. Furthermore, competitiveness equips individuals to navigate the real-world challenges they will inevitably encounter in their careers, education, and other aspects of life.Conversely, an excessive focus on competitiveness can be harmful. It may lead to heightened stress, anxiety, and an unhealthy obsession with winning at the expense of learning and self-development. Those who become overly competitive might place greater importance on success than on their relationships, mental health, or overall well-being. An overly competitive environment can also create a ruthless atmosphere, where individuals are willing to compromise their values and ethics in pursuit of victory.In summary, while competitiveness can serve as a motivating force that encourages individuals to realize their potential, it's crucial to maintain a balance between competitive spirit and other values like collaboration, empathy, and self-awareness. When harnessed properly, competitiveness can be a transformative asset for personal development and achievement; however, when it becomes excessive, it can lead to negative consequences for both individuals and society as a whole.

question: Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.Discuss both sides and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Computers are presntly an integral part of the civilized world and are essential to daily living. Some individuals believe that they should be introduced into the classroom and used for teaching purposes while others are of the opinion that dependence on computers in teaching may pose a risk to students.Introducing computers and their programs in educational instuitions for learning purposes is a beneficial thing to students. The world is fast changing and students need to meet up and be at par with others in the world. The globe is becoming a more digital place and computers are the core of that, teaching using computers will open students' minds to new possibilitiies, faster approaches and more advanced ways of solving problems. A recent study showed that 75% of students who were taught using computers are currently more successful than others in their work places.It is understandable that people also think that dependence on computers in teaching may be detrimental to students. The students may become lazy and may not necessarily want to use their brains to calculate or understand things because the computer has already done that for them. Also using computers to learn in the school environment is also just adding to screen time for the learners; they are already being exposed to lots of wrong things at home adding school to it may not neceesarily the best option.Personally, students have a lot to learn using computers but truthfully speaking most of them already have the technological know how when it comes to using computers and if they actually want to learn more about how to use them, they can do so at home using the popular learning sites, it doesnt necessarily have to be introduced into the school learning system.In conclusion,computers are currently the foundation of the modern world and have their advantages and disadvantages, if they are put to the right use at the appropriate place and time, its benefits are beyond measure.
llm: The incorporation of computers in classrooms has sparked considerable discussion in recent years. On one hand, the introduction of computers can significantly enrich students' learning experiences. These devices and their applications facilitate interactive and engaging lessons, making complex topics more accessible. For example, educational software can simulate virtual labs where students can perform experiments and investigations safely. Furthermore, computers allow access to an extensive array of information, enabling students to research and learn at their own pace.Conversely, reliance on technology in education poses certain risks. An excessive dependence on computers can hinder the development of fundamental skills like handwriting and mental math. Additionally, computers can serve as distractions, with students potentially diverting their attention to non-educational activities such as social media and gaming. Research has indicated that students utilizing computers in the classroom often spend more time on non-academic pursuits than on genuine learning. Moreover, excessive computer use can reduce the important face-to-face interactions between students and teachers, which are vital for nurturing social and communication skills.In my view, while computers should be integrated into the classroom, it is crucial to do so in a balanced and regulated way. They have the potential to enhance the educational experience but should not take the place of traditional teaching methods. Educators must ensure that students use computers strictly for educational purposes and continue to cultivate essential skills such as handwriting and arithmetic. For instance, a teacher could assign a project that requires computer-based research while also mandating a handwritten report to present their findings. By achieving a balance between technology and conventional teaching approaches, students can harness the benefits of computers while mitigating associated risks.

question: Crime rates are likely to decline due to the advancements in technology, which will help prevent and solve crimes in an easier way. Do you agree or disagree?
human: Nowadays technology is advancing faster than ever and many fields are benefitting from the opportunities this trend presents. Some think that crime prevention can be one possible application of new technologies, by allowing to deter offenders or solve crimes in a faster and easier way. In my opinion, innovation in crime prevention can be a game-changer that will reduce both the number of crimes committed and the time it takes to catch those responsible for them.Not everyone is optimistic about the prospects of the use of new technologies in crime prevention, and those who subscribe to the more pessimistic view say that advanced technologies can be accessed by criminals, therefore raising the crime rates. Such tools can, indeed, cause more damage if they fall in the wrong hands; however, it would require the offenders to be highly skilled to be able to use the modern technologies. Statistically, many of them tend to have a lower level of education, and for that reason they are likely to stick to the old ways of committing crimes, whereas the minority of highly skilled criminals are unlikely to make a big difference to the crime levels.Law enforcement workforce, on the other hand, has a much better grip on modern technology. Nowadays police officers and detectives undergo special training, take regular skill update courses, and use high-tech equipment. Facial recognition and thermal imaging are just two examples of the important tools that police are already using to find and catch offenders faster. Ordinary citizens can do their part in preventing burglaries by installing sophisticated systems with sensors, CCTV video feed and various alarms to detect and deter thieves. The combined effort will, no doubt, push the crime curve down.To sum up, even though the wonders of technology are available to everyone, it seems to me that they will better assist law enforcement in solving crimes, and law-abiding citizens in protecting themselves and their property, rather than felons. This will tip the balance in favour of reduction in crime rate and make the world a safer place.
llm: The idea that crime rates will decrease due to technological advancements is a topic of considerable debate. I believe that these advancements will indeed contribute to a decline in crime. A key reason for this is the improved capacity to prevent and solve crimes more efficiently.Thanks to innovations like CCTV cameras, artificial intelligence, and data analytics, law enforcement is now better positioned to monitor and pursue criminal activities. For example, facial recognition software and license plate readers have streamlined the process of identifying and apprehending offenders. Additionally, the ability to sift through large datasets allows authorities to spot trends and forecast potential crime hotspots, enabling them to implement more targeted and effective policing strategies.Furthermore, technology has empowered citizens to take a proactive stance in crime prevention and reporting. Mobile apps and online platforms facilitate the reporting of suspicious behavior and the sharing of information with law enforcement. This heightened civic involvement, paired with law enforcement's enhanced capabilities, is likely to deter would-be criminals and lead to a decrease in overall crime rates.It is essential, however, to recognize that technology can have negative implications as well, such as supporting new forms of crime like cybercrime and online fraud. Despite this, I firmly believe that the advantages of technological progress in crime prevention and resolution significantly outweigh its drawbacks. As technology evolves, it is poised to play an increasingly vital role in reducing crime and fostering safer communities. Ultimately, the successful integration of technology by both law enforcement and the public will be key to maximizing its potential in the fight against crime.

question: Dieting can change a person’s life for better or worse (from Target Band
human: This essay was written on a topic from “Target Band 7” book (page 54, reprinted with permission).You should spend about 40 minutes on this taskDieting can change a person’s life for the better or ruin one’s health completely. It cannot be denied that dieting taken to extremes may cause more harm than good, however, in my opinion effective dieting is pivotal for maintaining good health and keeping a more attractive body shape.First of all, the possibility of increasing level of physical health lies with incorporating proper dieting in our lives. It is reasonable to suggest that dieting is effective for controlling our body weight within an ideal range in order to achieve the normal score of body mass index (BMI), which is essential for preventing us from overweight or obese. As a result, the risk of suffering an illness will be reduced. A recent research concluded that dieting is one of the most effective measures to cut down one’s body weight among the obese group, and it helps to improve their medical condition indirectly.Moreover, dieting is crucial for keeping ideal body features regardless of gender and age. A fit and presentable body outlook absolutely boosts up one’s level in his or her social life, not to mention professions that require keeping one’s body in an attractive physical shape. For example, dieting is adopted as a popular way for reducing weight among actors and actresses. A recent article reported that an actress who successfully regained her slim body after a period of dieting was offered an excellent job opportunity in the Hollywood film industry.In conclusion, in my opinion dieting has a positive influence on one’s life in terms of maintaining a profound level of health and keeping a more attractive body outlook.The writer’s opinion is very clear from the start and throughout the entire essay. Paragraphing is used effectively to organise ideas and information. The use of advanced vocabulary enables accuracy of expression and highlights flexibility. Overall, the control of grammar and punctuation is good, with only a few errors made. The essay is a good example of an IELTS Band 8 work.
llm: The timeless saying "you are what you eat" rings true, highlighting the significant influence that our food choices have on our overall health. Dieting can be a double-edged sword, offering the potential for life-changing benefits or unintended consequences. On one side, a carefully crafted diet can lead to remarkable improvements in a person's life. By embracing a balanced and nutritious eating plan, individuals may achieve meaningful weight loss, increased energy, and greater mental clarity. Additionally, a wholesome diet has been linked to a lower risk of chronic illnesses like diabetes and heart disease, contributing to both longevity and quality of life.Conversely, dieting can have negative repercussions if not approached wisely. Extreme calorie restriction or trendy diets can result in malnutrition, fatigue, and an obsessive focus on food. This unhealthy preoccupation can even lead to eating disorders like anorexia and bulimia. Furthermore, the relentless pressure to conform to unrealistic body standards may contribute to low self-esteem, anxiety, and depression. Thus, it is crucial to adopt a balanced and sustainable approach to dieting, prioritizing gradual lifestyle changes over quick fixes and miracle diets.In summary, dieting has the potential to either enhance or harm an individual's life, largely depending on the methods employed. While a thoughtful diet can foster improved physical and mental well-being, a misguided or excessive approach can lead to serious and lasting effects. Therefore, it is vital to cultivate a healthy and sustainable relationship with food, rather than fixating on unattainable beauty ideals or rapid weight loss. By taking this approach, people can ensure that their dieting experience is both positive and transformative.

llm: The timeless saying "you are what you eat" carries a significant truth, as dietary choices can greatly influence an individual's life. In my view, dieting can be a double-edged sword, possessing the potential to enhance one's life or completely undermine one's health. On one hand, a well-structured and balanced diet can provide numerous benefits, including weight loss, increased energy, and a lower risk of chronic illnesses like diabetes and heart disease. Additionally, a nutritious diet can enhance mental well-being, leading to greater self-confidence, self-esteem, and overall happiness.Conversely, extreme or unbalanced dieting can result in severe consequences. llm: The idea of dieting has firmly established itself as a prevalent part of contemporary life, with countless individuals embracing various dietary plans in hopes of achieving a healthier and more attractive physique. I believe that dieting can be a double-edged sword, having the potential to either enhance one's life or cause significant harm to health.On one side, a thoughtfully designed and balanced diet can greatly improve a person's life. By making educated food choices and developing healthy eating habits, individuals can enjoy notable weight loss, heightened energy levels, and better overall wellness. Additionally, a nutritious diet can lower the chances of chronic illnesses like diabetes, heart disease, and certain cancers, ultimately leading to a longer and higher-quality life.Conversely, dieting can yield serious negative effects if approached imprudently or unsustainably. Fad diets, crash diets, and other extreme dieting methods can result in malnutrition, eating disorders, and various health issues. Furthermore, the relentless drive to meet societal beauty ideals and the obsession with thinness can adversely affect mental health, causing anxiety, depression, and diminished self-worth.In the end, the secret to effective dieting lies in embracing a balanced and sustainable approach to nutrition. Instead of chasing quick fixes or the latest trends, individuals should aim to cultivate a long-term and nurturing relationship with food that emphasizes nourishment, enjoyment, and self-care. This way, they can reap the many advantages of dieting while minimizing its dangers, leading to a healthier, happier, and more satisfying life.

question: Discipline is a growing problem in modern schools. Some people think that parents should discipline their own children, while others think it should be the responsibility of the government. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: While some people argue that parents should take sole responsibility for disciplining their children, others take the view that the government should be in charge of such matters. In my opinion, the young generation should be primarily guided by their parents where rules of behavior and moral principles are concerned. However, in some instances government intervention is necessary.On one side of the argument, there are people who hold the opinion that the responsibility of disciplining a child falls squarely on parents’ shoulders, since they are their first educators, and it is their duty to equip their children with good manners and morals even before their first day at school. In addition, every family has a unique understanding of what a suitable form of discipline entails. Therefore, some parents are concerned that any form of punishment meted out at school might be too harsh. To overcome this issue, they believe that parents should be informed by the school of their child’s wrongdoing so that they could decide an appropriate consequence for their behavior at home.Unfortunately, not all parents are objective enough to make the right decisions when it comes to the upbringing of their children. Some may lack information or sound moral background to discipline their children in a meaningful way. Therefore, the state should shoulder some of the responsibility by implementing a strict set of guidelines and policies on how to discipline children at school. I believe that such policies result in children who flourish and are more likely to become productive citizens that actively contribute to a prosperous nation. Also, this would help both parents and teachers understand which punishments are suitable for minor infractions like missing an assignment or major incidents like bullying or skipping school.In conclusion, while both views are commonly held in society, I believe that the government must be actively involved in the policies related to discipline at schools as this would ensure the well-being and successful development of the youth.
llm: The topic of discipline in contemporary schools has ignited a vigorous debate regarding who should be responsible for enforcing it among children. Some advocate for parental responsibility, while others contend that the government should assume this role. In this essay, I will explore both viewpoints and share my thoughts.Supporters of parental discipline argue that parents are in the best position to manage their children's behavior since they know them intimately and can offer appropriate guidance. They believe that as the primary caregivers, parents should be accountable for their children's actions. By taking charge of discipline, parents can instill important values and morals that are vital for their children's growth and development.Conversely, some argue that the government should be responsible for discipline within educational settings. This perspective holds that schools mirror broader societal norms, and thus, the government must ensure that children learn and behave in a safe and respectful atmosphere. Additionally, the government possesses the resources and infrastructure to assist children facing behavioral challenges.In my view, discipline is a shared responsibility between parents and the government. While parents are instrumental in guiding their children's behavior, the government has an obligation to create a safe and supportive educational environment. A collaborative approach between parents and government can better equip children with the guidance and discipline necessary for their success. Ultimately, a unified strategy is crucial for the well-being and development of children in today’s schools.

question: Eating sweet foods produces acid in the mouth, which can cause tooth decay. (High acid levels are measured by low pH values)Describe the information below and discuss the implications for dental health.
human: The given graph shows the level of acidity in the mouth from consuming food that contains fruit or cane sugar and honey.To start with, if we take a look at honey-consistent food, we will notice that the acid level increases within the first 5 minutes. After that, the level of acidity remains at the rate of less than 5 pH, and, then goes down to a normal level. So, it is unlikely tooth decay to occur within such a short period of time.Regarding fruit and cane sugar-consistent food, it is quite noticeable that the acidity level increases dramatically at a level of less than 5.5 pH and 4.5 pH, respectively. However, the main difference between fruit and cane sugar is that the acid level of fruit sugar decreases within a bit more than 15 minutes. In contrast to it, the acid level of cane sugar goes down to a normal level within more than 25 minutes, which is more likely to get tooth decay.
llm: The intake of sugary foods has been associated with increased acid production in the mouth, which can negatively impact dental health. When sweets are consumed, the bacteria in the oral cavity break them down into acids, leading to a drop in pH levels. This rise in acidity can contribute to tooth decay, a condition marked by the loss of tooth enamel and the development of cavities.Research shows that pH levels can plummet to as low as 3.5 after consuming sugary foods. This acidic state may linger for significant periods, influenced by the type and quantity of sugary items eaten, as well as the individual's oral hygiene practices. Extended exposure to an acidic environment can weaken the tooth’s defense mechanisms, enabling acids to infiltrate deeper into the tooth structure, ultimately causing irreparable harm.The consequences for dental health are considerable, as frequent and prolonged exposure to acid can facilitate tooth decay and other oral health problems. Additionally, regularly consuming sweets may exacerbate existing issues, such as tooth sensitivity and gum disease. To reduce these risks, it is crucial to maintain good oral hygiene through regular brushing and flossing, as well as to limit the intake of sugary foods and beverages. Routine dental check-ups and cleanings can also help identify and address any potential problems before they escalate. By understanding the connection between sugar consumption and acid production, individuals can take proactive measures to safeguard their dental health and prevent tooth decay and related issues.

question: Education in financial management should be a mandatory component of the school program, agree/disagree (from Target Band
human: This essay was written on a topic from “Target Band 7” book (page 54, reprinted with permission).You should spend about 40 minutes on this taskEducation in financial management should be a mandatory component of the school program. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your experience.Write at least 250 wordsMore and more young adults in our country are heavily indebted. Thus, it is considered by some that it should be mandatory to educate school children the administration of money. In my opinion, people should not leave school without a sound knowledge of financial management.To begin with, a country’s development is strongly upon the purchasing capacity of its inhabitants. That is to say, people who are in debt or financially vulnerable, would not be able to spend freely or invest, for example, in a new house, thus hindering the economic growth of the country. As a consequence, the rate of inflation would rise and people would be able to afford even less, which could ultimately result in the collapse of the entire economy. A good example of this vicious circle can be seen in countries such as Argentina, where people have to buy household items in the black market, because they cannot afford to buy them in regular stores due to skyrocketing prices. Therefore, it is of utmost importance to teach children early money management.Another point to consider is the low standard of living that people have when they mismanage their finances. Individuals who are constantly short of money could eventually end up being socially isolated and unhappy, because they couldn’t afford to participate in leisure activities, such as going to the cinema with a friend, resulting in their from social life. However, this could be avoided with ease by offering courses in money management.In conclusion, I strongly believe that school children should be taught how to manage their finances to prevent social isolation later in their life as well as to maintain the economic force of their country.The writer’s position is clear throughout the essay. Paragraphing is used effectively to organise ideas and information, however the paragraphs could have been balanced better in terms of the amount of content. The advanced vocabulary the writer uses creates a good impression of mature and fluent writer. Overall, the control of grammar and punctuation is fine, and the number of errors is small. The essay could achieve Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: I wholeheartedly believe that financial management education should be an essential part of the school curriculum. In our complex and constantly evolving financial environment, it is crucial for individuals to have a clear understanding of personal finance and effective money management skills. By integrating financial management into schools, we can provide students with the knowledge and resources they need to make informed choices regarding their financial well-being.Many young people graduate without even a basic grasp of financial management, which can result in poor financial choices and a cycle of debt. By incorporating financial education in schools, students can acquire essential skills such as budgeting, saving, and investing, which will serve them well throughout their lives. Additionally, a solid foundation in financial literacy will help them navigate decisions related to student loans, credit cards, and other financial products, enabling them to avoid common traps that lead to financial hardship.Moreover, teaching financial management in educational institutions can positively influence society as a whole. By fostering an understanding of saving, spending, and investing, we can cultivate a culture of financial responsibility and stability. This cultural shift can contribute to reduced debt levels, better credit ratings, and a more secure financial future for both individuals and the broader economy.In summary, I strongly advocate for financial management education as a mandatory element of the school program. By equipping students with a robust understanding of financial literacy, we can empower them to make wise decisions about their finances and lay the groundwork for lasting financial success. This, in turn, can enhance the well-being of individuals, strengthen communities, and contribute to a more stable and prosperous economy for everyone.

question: Even though Globalization affects the world’s economics in a very positive way, its negative sides should not be forgotten. Discuss.

llm: The rise of globalization has transformed the global economy, facilitating unparalleled growth and interconnectedness among nations. While the benefits are clear, we must also consider the adverse effects of globalization. On the positive side, it has opened new markets, created job opportunities, and enabled the flow of goods, services, and ideas, resulting in economic expansion, better living standards, and reduced poverty in many areas.Nevertheless, we cannot ignore the negative aspects of globalization. A major concern is the growing income disparity between the wealthy and the poor. In their quest for low-cost labor and resources, multinational corporations often exploit workers in developing countries, reinforcing inequality and social injustice. Additionally, small local businesses frequently struggle to compete with these large corporations, leading to the decline of local industries and cultural homogenization, where distinctive customs and traditions are overshadowed by dominant global brands.Moreover, globalization has drawn criticism for its environmental impact. The increased movement of goods and services has significantly raised greenhouse gas emissions, contributing to climate change. As the focus on economic growth intensifies, the exploitation of natural resources jeopardizes biodiversity and ecological balance. It is crucial to recognize and address these negative ramifications to ensure the equitable and sustainable distribution of globalization's benefits. By doing so, we can strive for a more balanced globalization that supports economic growth, social justice, and environmental sustainability. Ultimately, acknowledging both the positive and negative dimensions of globalization is vital for fostering a more just and prosperous world for everyone.

question: Even though experts believe that walking is a great way to improve one’s health, very few people walk nowadays. Why aren’t people walking? What can be done to encourage them to walk more?
human: The benefits of walking are numerous, and experts recommend it as a good way to keep healthy and fit. Despite this, the number of people who walk on a daily basis is on the decline. The reasons for this are manifold, but there are also several solutions that may help people walk more.Lack of time is the most common reason people cite for not engaging in any form of physical activity. These days most people have hectic schedules that involve juggling their work and home responsibilities. As a result, they are often too exhausted or pressed for time and therefore opt for faster and more comfortable forms of transport, such as cars, bikes or public transport. Another major reason for the reduced number of pedestrians on the roads is a lack of safety. Most full-time workers are not free to walk during the day, and will skip it in the evenings or early morning hours, if they do not feel safe enough to do so.Fortunately, there are quite a few solutions to this issue. One is making walkers safe, which means the government should ensure that there are enough sidewalks and streetlights available in every suburb, so that pedestrians can walk or jog safely whenever time allows. Another useful option is to create special walking tracks and parks in neighbourhoods where people can get some much-needed exercise in the evenings. The added benefit of promoting the healthy lifestyle and walking in the community makes this solution even more attractive.To conclude, the pressures of daily life and lack of safely while walking reduce the popularity of this healthy practice. Governments can reverse this trend by creating more green spaces for people to walk in and addressing their safety concerns.
llm: Despite the many health benefits of walking, it's concerning that so few individuals include it in their everyday activities. A major contributor to this trend is our growing dependence on technology and various modes of transportation. With the convenience of cars, buses, and trains, many have become accustomed to these quick options and overlook the most basic yet effective way to maintain health—walking. Additionally, the typical sedentary nature of modern jobs, which often require long hours of sitting, further diminishes walking habits.Another key issue is the insufficient infrastructure supporting pedestrians. In numerous cities, sidewalks and walking paths are either lacking or not well-maintained, making it both challenging and unsafe for people to walk. On top of that, the enticing nature of screen-based entertainment and social media has fostered a more sedentary lifestyle, leading many to choose indoor activities over physical ones like walking.To promote walking more widely, governments and local authorities have a vital role to play. They can enhance pedestrian-friendly infrastructure by ensuring sidewalks, crosswalks, and bike lanes are well-maintained, thereby creating a safer and more enjoyable environment for walkers. Additionally, initiatives such as "walk to work" or "walk to school" days could help raise awareness about the advantages of walking and foster a culture of physical activity. On an individual level, people can strive to weave walking into their daily routines—whether by taking short walks during lunch breaks or opting to walk to nearby stores instead of driving. By implementing these simple changes, we can significantly boost our health and well-being while setting a positive example for others. Ultimately, recognizing the importance of walking and collectively promoting a walking culture is essential.

question: Even though globalization affects the world’s economy in a very positive way, its negative side should not be forgotten. Discuss.
human: Everything has two sides and the globalization is not exception. Our first thoughts about this topic include the process of global “McDonaldisation” and, generally speaking, spreading across the whole Globe.Firstly, I would try to concentrate on the positive aspects of globalisation. As far as economy is concerned, like the Global Bank or IMF are always focused on developing the ‘Third World’ and helping poor people to combat their life obstacles (through loans and donations). Moreover, the world becomes an area of sharing thoughts (e.g. philosophical or economical doctrines), which become popular due to lack of barriers.However, disadvantages of globalization are also widely known. Some people insist that because of this process, the spirit of countries and nations rapidly disappears. The integrity, established years ago is on the verge of collapsing. Furthermore, there’s a strong lobby of communists who , that the globalization indicates an uncontrolled reign of capitalists and slave work of lower labour-class. We should never forget about the detrimental impact of global investments on the environment – the green house effect or soar rains are triggered by globalization.To sum up, globalization has both positive and negative influence on our everyday life. I can’t agree with the popular statement that we should try to avoid being affected by it. However, we must not forget about our surroundings and local communities. They have a great value which should last forever.
llm: The rise of globalization has undeniably reshaped the global economy in many positive ways. It has promoted the seamless exchange of goods, services, and ideas across national borders, resulting in enhanced economic growth, job creation, and cultural interaction. Globalization has also allowed multinational companies to broaden their reach, generating fresh opportunities for investment and trade. Consequently, numerous nations have witnessed substantial economic expansion, lifting millions out of poverty and elevating living standards.Nevertheless, we must not ignore the adverse effects of globalization. One key concern is the increasing income disparity between the wealthy and the impoverished. As large corporations grow their influence, small businesses and local industries often find it difficult to compete, resulting in job losses and greater economic inequality. Additionally, the phenomenon has led to the exploitation of inexpensive labor in developing nations, where workers frequently endure poor conditions and meager wages.Moreover, globalization contributes to environmental harm and cultural homogenization. The rising demand for natural resources has led to issues like pollution, deforestation, and climate change. Furthermore, the predominance of Western culture and values poses a threat to the distinct identities of many societies, leading to the erosion of traditional practices and customs.In summary, while globalization has undoubtedly yielded significant economic advantages, its negative impacts cannot be overlooked. It is vital to recognize and address these challenges to ensure that the benefits of globalization are equitably and sustainably distributed. Collaborative efforts among governments, corporations, and individuals are necessary to alleviate the detrimental consequences of globalization and foster a more inclusive and environmentally friendly economic framework. By doing so, we can work towards a fairer world where the advantages of globalization are accessible to everyone.

question: Every household should have a government-imposed limit on the amount of rubbish it can throw away. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The amount of waste people produce can be quite shocking, with every person generating kilograms of rubbish in a single day, and all this can be difficult to manage. This has given some people the idea that there should be a limitation on the amount of rubbish produced per household; however, opinions are divided as to whether this would be the the most effective option.Having a limitation on the amount of waste produced sounds like a fine solution to a significant problem, with over two hundred and fifty million tons being generated in 2016 by the U.S. alone. Taxing households that break limits would push people to produce less waste and make them more mindful of what can be recycled or composted. However, forcing people to produce less waste might not be attainable.Households produce as much waste as they need to live their lifestyles. The waste people generate is only a result of the products they purchase, and will most likely wish to continue to purchase. Taxing people may be a cause of resentment, with many of them already struggling to pay their usual bills. In addition, if people produce more than they are allowed, this will encourage littering and dumping, so that they are not caught with more waste than entitled, and this in turn will damage the environment.Though controlling the amount of waste produced is important, there could be other ways of encouraging lesser output. In my opinion, governments should encourage composting and recycling, which will also reduce wasted material. People should also be more aware of what waste they produce and how it can be reduced.
