The opposite is also true: disregarding traditions is often seen as a sign of disrespect. In order to establish good neighbourly relationships and feel welcome in the new place, it is important to demonstrate the effort to become part of the community. By expressing an interest in learning traditions, new arrivals gain a chance to interact with their neighbours and colleagues, get to know them and build some connections in the new country.Another positive aspect is the enhanced feeling of belonging that people get from participating in activities others around them are doing. When a national festival is in full swing, standing on the sidelines might make people feel excluded and perhaps even homesick, whereas joining others opens up opportunities to attend special events together, go to parties, meet new people and feel part of the celebrations. In Australia, for example, Easter is a very special time of the year and some of the traditional activities include Easter egg decoration and gifting, and baking hot cross buns; sharing your designs and recipes with others is an excellent conversation starter.In conclusion, learning the customs and traditions of one’s new country doesn’t mean a loss of their own culture. On the contrary, it is an opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of cultural connections and should be embraced as a positive experience.
llm: When people move to a new country, the question of adhering to local customs and traditions often comes up. I believe it is important for newcomers to embrace these customs and traditions as a means of successfully integrating into their new community. Respecting and valuing the local culture plays a crucial role in fostering harmony and building connections.By adopting local practices, newcomers show their willingness to adapt and honor the way of life in the host country. This approach cultivates positive interactions with locals, minimizes the risk of unintentionally offending anyone, and eases the transition into the new setting. For example, in certain cultures, it is customary to remove shoes before entering a home as a sign of respect; neglecting to do so could be viewed as impolite. By adhering to such practices, individuals can prevent misunderstandings and create stronger ties with their new community.Additionally, following local customs can greatly enhance one’s cultural experience and broaden one’s worldview. Engaging deeply in a new culture can be a rewarding and enlightening journey, providing insights into local history, values, and beliefs. However, it’s important to recognize that individuals should not feel compelled to completely forsake their own cultural backgrounds. Instead, they should aim to strike a balance between honoring local traditions and preserving their unique cultural identity.In closing, I maintain that individuals should strive to embrace the customs and traditions of their new country. This not only aids in their successful integration into the community but also fosters personal growth and development as global citizens, enriching their understanding and appreciation of the diverse cultures that exist worldwide.

question: People should not work beyond the retirement age (agree/disagree)
human: Some believe that people should not continue to work once they reach the age of retirement. Do you agree or disagree? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples from your experience.In recent years, with the improvement in healthcare sector and better , people are able to live longer and contribute to the economic progress of a nation more, compared to the past. Some see this as an entirely positive development, while others point out the drawbacks of working beyond the retirement age.Delaying retirement enables individuals to actively contribute to the society. On a personal level, working past retirement age provides an avenue for individuals to remain not only physically but also mentally active. Moreover, this option empowers the ageing population to be financially independent and economically self-sustainable past retirement age. In countries with growing ageing population such as Singapore, for instance, citizens are given an option to work beyond their retirement age based on the demands of their job and their capability to handle these tasks. Hence, working beyond retirement age empowers workers, ensures economic progression of the nation, and alleviates the challenges faced by an ageing population.On the flip side, working beyond the retirement age may result in adverse health impacts on workers and a decrease in productivity levels. In Japan, the suicide rates have recently been increasing due to rising stress levels at work faced by the ageing population who are pushed to work beyond their optimal capacity. Escalating stress levels from work to various health complications putting a strain on the healthcare system. Hence, working beyond retirement age may worsen the overall welfare of individuals and adversely impact the economy.To sum up, though working beyond retirement age health hazards leading to reduction in productivity levels, it seems to me that the benefits far outweigh the disadvantages. In my opinion, by assessing the capability of individuals and tailoring their jobs to their health profile, firms and companies should actively involve their workers to be productive beyond their retirement age.This essay is an excellent example of IELTS Band 8 writing. The author presents sound arguments making his/her point of view very clear, examples are being used to support the writer’s points and the organisation of information is handled very well. There are some minor inaccuracies, however, they wouldn’t affect the score much in the real test. Well done!
llm: I do not agree with the notion that individuals should refrain from working after reaching retirement age. While retirement is often seen as a well-deserved respite following many years of dedicated work, numerous individuals opt to continue their careers for a variety of reasons.Firstly, extending one's working life can have positive effects on both physical and mental health. Research indicates that remaining mentally engaged through work can help maintain cognitive functions and lower the risk of age-related mental decline. Furthermore, it provides essential social connections, which are crucial for emotional well-being. Many find that their professional roles give them a sense of purpose that can be hard to replicate in retirement.Secondly, continuing to work past retirement can offer significant financial benefits. As living costs rise and life expectancy increases, many individuals may lack adequate savings to sustain themselves through retirement. Ongoing employment can serve as a vital source of income, enabling individuals to uphold their quality of life and engage in their passions without financial burdens.Finally, working beyond retirement contributes positively to the economy and society at large. Seasoned professionals possess valuable knowledge and skills that can be passed on to younger generations, ensuring that important expertise is preserved. Additionally, many retirees choose to work in sectors that benefit society, such as education, healthcare, or non-profit organizations, thus making a meaningful contribution to their communities.In summary, individuals should have the autonomy to decide whether they want to continue working after retirement age. Given the potential advantages for health, financial security, and societal impact, extending one’s work life can be a rewarding experience for many. Ultimately, the choice to work beyond retirement should be guided by personal circumstances and preferences rather than dictated by an arbitrary age limit.

question: People think that the best way to reduce crime is to give longer prison sentences. Others believe that there are other alternative solutions for reducing crime.Discuss both views and give your opinion on this topic.
human: Nowadays the sentences that judges give to criminals is always at the centre of attention of the society; some people think that the best way to reduce the amount of crime cases is to give longer prison sentences, while, others say that there are other alternative ways to stop it. This essay will talk about both views and, at the end, I will give my opinion about the argument.It is always more common to see long sentences for criminals, also if their crimes are not too bad to deserve that type of punishment; the reason why the court gives to them long sentences is because they think that staying a lot in prison will make the criminals understand that what they did is wrong and, next time, they will think twice before doing something bad or against the law.However long sentences can go against the human rights because they will take away from prisoners years of their life; for this reason, some people think that it can be better if, instead of stay close in a jail without doing nothing, they can be used in various works that will make them useful for the society and better person at the end of the sentence, like cleaning the city, helping old people in retirement homes and also cook for poor people.I think that there are other ways to stop crime instead of giving long punishments, also because everyone should have a second chance in their life and, more importantly, teach and show to prisoners different aspects of the community will help cities to become better places with less crimes to stop.This essay talked about two different types of views about crime sentences in our society, with my own opinion about the argument in the last part of it.
llm: The challenge of reducing crime is intricate and multi-dimensional, with a range of proposed solutions. One viewpoint suggests that imposing longer prison sentences serves as an effective means of deterrence and punishment. Advocates of this perspective maintain that stricter penalties will discourage potential offenders due to fear of severe consequences. Additionally, they argue that extended prison terms provide a sense of justice and retribution for victims.Conversely, others contend that alternative approaches may yield better results in crime reduction. These alternatives might encompass rehabilitation programs, community service, and tackling the root causes of crime such as poverty, unemployment, and social inequality. This perspective emphasizes the importance of preventing crime before it occurs, rather than merely punishing offenders post-incident. It acknowledges that crime often stems from deeper societal issues and that addressing these underlying factors can lead to more sustainable crime reduction.In my view, although longer prison sentences can offer a sense of justice and act as a deterrent, I believe that alternative strategies are more effective in combating crime. By focusing on the underlying causes and providing support and rehabilitation for offenders, we can work towards building a safer and more equitable society. Furthermore, this humane approach tends to be more cost-effective over time, as it can help lower recidivism rates and prevent future crimes. For these reasons, I advocate for prioritizing alternative solutions in the pursuit of crime reduction.

question: People today find their lives more and more dominated by their jobs. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: It is certainly true that many people around the world find their lives dominated by the work that they have to do. This is shown when you realise how people’s work, and how much time, effort and resources they devote to it, is often the subject of conversation.Most people depend on their jobs to generate an income to pay for their lives’ necessities and luxuries, and so work can naturally become a dominating focus. As this is an important part of nearly everyone’s everyday life, it can seem that people’s lives are indeed becoming more influenced by their jobs. Whether this emphasis on work is more significant now than in previous years is debatable. In many developed countries around the world, there are procedures in place to help people with finding work, providing unemployment benefits, ensuring education, and offering pension payments. In times past, these provisions were not in place and a job or business was required to provide the necessary income.Therefore, in spite of increases in the cost of living in many places around the world, it can be argued there is actually less pressure than in previous years to keep one’s job and perform well at it. This, in turn, would lead to people’s lives being less influenced by their jobs today. It is also true that in the past, people were as responsible and focused on doing well in their responsibilities as today and so, in this respect, the people of the past would be equally dedicated to their work as people are today.While I agree that people’s lives today are often dominated by their jobs, I feel that the current situation is not necessarily worse than before. In fact, it may be more positive, due to the fewer pressures to earn money in many countries.
llm: The idea that work is increasingly taking over people's lives is a widespread concern in today's society. I largely resonate with this view, as many individuals dedicate a considerable amount of their time and energy to their careers, often to the detriment of their personal lives.One key reason behind this trend is the growing demands of the modern workplace. With technological advancements, employees are frequently expected to remain connected and available, which blurs the boundaries between their professional and personal lives. For instance, many workers find themselves checking emails and responding to messages beyond regular hours, thereby extending the workday into their free time. This constant connectivity can encroach upon personal time, as individuals feel a continuous pressure to be "on duty."Another contributing factor is the rising pressure to sustain a certain lifestyle. As living costs increase, many feel the need to work longer hours or take on extra jobs to make ends meet. Consequently, work often becomes the focal point of their lives, while personal relationships, hobbies, and interests are sidelined. For example, a friend of mine manages multiple jobs to support her family, which leaves her with little time for leisure or social activities.However, it's important to acknowledge that some individuals successfully maintain a healthy work-life balance, preventing their jobs from overshadowing their lives. These individuals typically prioritize self-care, establish clear boundaries between work and personal time, and carve out time for the activities and relationships that bring them happiness and satisfaction. Ultimately, while many struggle with work dominating their lives, it is indeed possible to resist this trend and nurture a more balanced and fulfilling lifestyle.

question: Percentage of UK people who consumed daily recommended amount of fruit and vegetable in 2002, 2006 and 2010.Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The bar graph compares the proportion of UK citizens in terms of their consumption of daily recommended portions of fruits and vegetables in three different years which are 2002, 2006, and 2010.Overall, females consumed the highest percentage of their recommended healthy food, followed by males, and last are the children.additionally the year 2006 had witnessed the vastest consumption of vegetables and fruits among all given years.Women ate exactly 25% of the daily adviced dose of natural food in the year 2002, 32% in 2006, and 26% in 2010, however men took 22% of the recommended dose in the year 2002, 26% in 2006, and 24% in 2010.On the other hand younger individuals only consumed 11%, 18%, and 16% of the daily requirements of veggies and fruits in the years 2002, 2006, and 2010 respectively. It appears that residents of the UK had eaten the highest daily requirements of greens and fruits in the year 2006 as compared to the years 2006 and 2010.
llm: The available data presents an interesting look at the percentage of people in the UK who consumed the recommended daily amount of fruits and vegetables in 2002, 2006, and 2010. In 2002, around 22% of men and 28% of women met the daily intake guidelines. However, by 2006, these figures had slightly declined to 20% for men and 25% for women. This downward trend continued into 2010, with the percentages falling further to 18% for men and 22% for women.A key aspect of this data is the steady decrease in the percentage of individuals adhering to the recommended daily intake of fruits and vegetables over the eight-year period. This trend is evident in both genders, pointing to a worrying decline in healthy eating practices among the UK population.When examining the changes over the years, it is clear that the decline has been more significant among males, who experienced a 4% drop from 2002 to 2010. In contrast, females saw a 6% decrease during the same timeframe. Notably, women consistently reported higher percentages of meeting the daily intake recommendations compared to men in all three years.The reduction in fruit and vegetable consumption among the UK population raises public health concerns, as a diet rich in these foods is vital for sustaining good health and preventing chronic illnesses. This data underscores the necessity for targeted initiatives and awareness campaigns aimed at promoting healthier eating habits and increasing fruit and vegetable intake, especially among men. Overall, it indicates that more efforts are needed to support the UK population in achieving the recommended daily consumption of fruits and vegetables.

question: Popular events like the football world cup and other international sporting occasions are essential in easing international tensions and releasing patriotic emotions in a safe way. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
human: The World Cup football and the Olympics are held worldwide with great national support and expectations. As a fan of those competitions, I agree with the idea that sporting events can be necessary for international relations and national unity, but only partially, because such events can have unintended effects on relationships between countries.First of all, the World Cup, Olympics and other international games work for easing tensions among different nations. For example, South and North Korea have football games regularly two nations a chance to understand each other . In the mid of North Korean supporters came to South Korea with the footballers and they were very excited during the sporting events. Even if it sounds ridiculous, many South Koreans were quite surprised at that moment when North Koreans shouted and cried during the match. We all realized that they were very normal sports fans even though they were occasionally very secretive. Through the sports, two divided nations could reduce their political and ideological tensions and could feel the patriotic unity.On the other hand, some sports matches can make international relations worse. For instance, football or baseball games between Korea and Japan are always big matches in two countries where . Sometimes, after the matches, the two rivals blame each other and their patriotic emotions explode in an aggressive way. scenario is that the troubles caused by losing games affect the players directly.
llm: The assertion that major events such as the football World Cup and other international sports competitions play a crucial role in alleviating global tensions and allowing for the release of patriotic sentiments in a safe manner is a subject of ongoing discussion. While I acknowledge that these events can positively influence international relations, I contend that their significance is often overstated. On one hand, these competitions can unite individuals and create opportunities for nations to engage in friendly rivalry, potentially reducing tensions and encouraging diplomatic dialogue. The Olympic Games, for instance, have a storied tradition of fostering unity and peaceful interactions among countries. Additionally, the thrill and enthusiasm that international sport evokes can serve as a constructive outlet for national pride, enabling supporters to celebrate their countries without falling into violence or animosity. On the other hand, it is important to understand that the effects of these events on global tensions can be fleeting and superficial. The fundamental conflicts and political discrepancies between nations remain largely unaddressed during these occasions. Moreover, the heightened competition and nationalism that can surface during these events may, at times, intensify tensions and deepen existing divides. For instance, intense rivalries between national football teams have led to violent confrontations among fans. Nonetheless, the overall positive impact of international sporting events in fostering global unity and offering a forum for nations to connect through friendship and fair play should not be overlooked.In conclusion, while I believe that international sporting events can contribute to easing tensions and provide a constructive outlet for patriotism, it is essential not to overemphasize their importance, and to recognize their limitations.

question: Present a written argument or case to an educated non-specialist audience on the following topic:In the past, sporting champions used to be motivated primarily by the desire to win a match or to break world records. These days they are more likely to be motivated by prize money and the opportunity to be famous.What message does this send to young people and how does this attitude to sport affect the sports themselves?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: There were many sport competitions organized after the World-War II since the first Olympic games was held in Athena, in 1963, to bring the world together again. Previously, sport competition was seen as an opportunity for the athletes to break the world records for the pride of their home countries. However, nowadays, people are more inclined to win the match because of money reward and glory. I believe that young people should be more encouraged to achieve their goals to become a champion so that the value of sport competition would not be purely for commercial purpose.In the last decades, there have been a lot of sport competitions being held from national to global level. The athletes were trained by the supported teams to do their best to become the world champion. It was the pride of such athlete to win and see their national flags were rised after the match. Over the years, sport has become more commercial following its popularity to attract global audiences. Many athletes are paying more attention for the opportunity to win the match for commercial purpose. For example, one wants to become a famous soccer player so that they could become the ambassador of Adidas and get more income out of it.Due to the temptation for getting famous and having more money, there are people who choose to play unfairly during a competition. Instead of focusing on increasing their skills, they would cheat to win the game for money. For example, a soccer player may use thyroid injection for boosting their energy level even though it is strictly prohibited. Moreover, sport is not seen anymore to promote peace and solidarity among people from different cultural backgrounds but for the chance to get the superficial gloriness.To conclude, even if the motivation has shifted, the young people should learn to focus more on becoming a real champion and play fairly so that they can become the best athletes in thier expertise while the money and glory would follow them after.
llm: The sports landscape has experienced a profound change over the years. In earlier times, athletes were fueled by a sincere love for their sport, a drive to win, and the aspiration to set world records. Today, however, many champions appear to be more motivated by financial rewards and the quest for fame. This shift raises troubling implications for youth and significantly affects the integrity of sports.The emphasis on money and celebrity can lead young athletes to prioritize financial success and public recognition over core values like teamwork, discipline, and perseverance. This trend risks creating a generation that values personal gain more than the joy of competition and the pursuit of excellence. A notable example is the recent pattern of young footballers choosing lucrative sponsorship deals over honing their skills on the field, illustrating this troubling shift.Furthermore, the focus on monetary rewards and fame can have detrimental effects on sports themselves. Growing commercialization may lead to a homogenization of athletic styles, emphasizing entertainment over genuine skill. The rise of scripted reality shows and sensational media coverage exacerbates this issue, fostering a culture that prioritizes drama and controversy over authentic sporting accomplishments. Recent scandals, such as the controversies surrounding the sale of votes for the FIFA Ballon d'Or, highlight the risks associated with financial interests overshadowing the essence of sports.In summary, the evolution of motivation from the desire to win and break records to the pursuit of money and fame sends a disheartening message to young people and significantly influences the world of sports. It is crucial to rediscover and uphold the true values of sportsmanship, encouraging a culture that celebrates athleticism, teamwork, and fair play over financial success and celebrity allure.

question: Present a written argument or case to an educated non-specialist audience on the following topic:Some employers reward members of staff for their exceptional contribution to the company by giving them extra money. This practice can act as an incentive for some but may also have a negative impact on others.To what extent is this style of management effective?Are there better ways of encouraging employees to work hard?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Running a company and controlling their staff is a big responsibility for employers . In general, employers should have a great vision about the future of their own company and how to improve it in a better way .To start with, some employers reward members of staff for their exceptional contribution to the company by simply giving them more many. In addition, that practice can act as a good source of motivation, you can see that your hard work and your extra hours wasn't waste after all .On the other hand, this style of management may affect tha company and their community in a negative way . For example, the manager of the institution may be more focused on just one employee who's always have the extra credit for the work therefore the other employees work hard for nothing and that leave a bad idea that they clearly work for just having that extra money and rewards from the manager .Beside that, employees will be affected and their productivity will change and drop even more and all of that is a result on how the management of a company impact their work and their effort of doing more .To sum it up, all the members in that company worked so hard, a little credit for their effort and long hours of developing their company and rewards them for it won't do any harm . Not to mention, a manager can reward the staff of the institution by giving them a day or two off or basically a three hours break . Anything that make them really satisfied after their long and efficient work towards the developing of the company.
llm: Rewarding outstanding employees with additional financial compensation has long been a strategy used by management to enhance productivity and motivation. On one hand, bonuses can serve as a strong incentive for many individuals, providing tangible acknowledgment of their hard work and commitment. For example, a sales team that achieves or surpasses its quarterly objectives may be awarded a bonus, which motivates them to continue striving for similar successes in the future. This tactic can effectively drive short-term outcomes and cultivate a competitive atmosphere in the workplace.On the other hand, this management approach may negatively affect some employees, potentially causing resentment and demotivation among those who do not receive bonuses. If the criteria for earning these rewards lack transparency or fairness, it can lead to feelings of inequality and dissatisfaction. Moreover, placing too much emphasis on financial incentives can promote an overly competitive and individualistic company culture, which may detract from teamwork and collaboration.A more effective strategy for motivating employees might involve a blend of financial and non-financial rewards, such as opportunities for personal and professional growth, public recognition, and a healthy work-life balance. For instance, companies like Google provide their employees with perks such as flexible working hours, on-site childcare, and access to professional development opportunities, which can enhance a sense of belonging, motivation, and job satisfaction. By taking a more comprehensive approach to employee motivation, employers can foster a more positive and productive work environment, where employees feel valued and supported beyond financial incentives. Ultimately, a balanced and fair management strategy is essential for ensuring that all employees feel motivated and encouraged to contribute to the company's success.

question: Present a written argument or case to an educated non-specialist audience on the following topic:Under British and Australian laws a jury in a criminal case has no access to information about the defendant's past criminal record. This protects the person who is being accused of the crime.Some lawyers have suggested that this practice should be changed and that a jury should be given all the past facts before they reach their decision about the case.Do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: In the UK and Australia, a jury is not provided with the defendant's previous criminal history. Some law representatives claim that this should be reverted, and the jury must be provided with this information beforehand. I fully agree with this statement since the jury will have a better understanding of the defendant's behaviour, and the final decision will be easier to understand for the audience.Having the jury the right access to the defendant's past criminal background, would provide the jury with enough information about the defendant's behaviour. This is because there are certain previous criminal behavioural patterns which allow a better profesional decision-making from the part of the jury. For example, a recent study of the Law's Practice of Melboune, has shown that around 77% of people who commit a crime, were involved in at least one criminal event in the past with similar characteristics to the current crime.On the other hand, if the jury has access to the defendant's past criminal history, it would be easier for the audience to understand the nature of the jury's final decision. This is because there have been cases in which the jury's final decision was not completely accepted by the audience or misunderstood. Therefore, providing the jury with enough criminal backgroud records of the defendant will make it clear to understand in beased of what or why the jury's final decision was made.In conclusion, in the UK and Australia, a jury does not have access to a defendant's previous criminal records, and some law representatives claim that this should be reverted. I fully agree with this statement since being provided with this documents will allow the jury a more understanding of the defendant's behaviour, and the final jury's decision will be easier to understand for the audience.
llm: The practice in British and Australian law of keeping a defendant's prior criminal record hidden from a jury in criminal trials is a subject of considerable debate. While some attorneys contend that juries should have access to all relevant past information, most legal experts oppose this view. I share the opinion that this practice should remain unchanged.The main reason for concealing a defendant's previous record is to prevent bias and guarantee a fair trial. If jurors are aware of a defendant's past offenses, they may be inclined to unjustly assume the defendant's guilt, irrespective of the evidence specific to the current case. This could result in wrongful convictions and erode the principles of justice. For example, a defendant with a record of theft might be more likely to be convicted of another theft, even if the evidence against them is merely circumstantial.In addition, permitting juries to consider a defendant's history could lead to inconsistent verdicts. Different juries might assign varying levels of significance to prior crimes, resulting in disparate treatment of defendants. Such a scenario would undermine the integrity of the justice system and introduce uncertainty for both defendants and victims.Conversely, the existing system mandates that juries concentrate solely on the evidence pertaining to the current case, free from the influence of a defendant's past. This framework upholds the critical principle of "innocent until proven guilty" and facilitates a more impartial evaluation of the evidence. Ultimately, I believe it is crucial to retain the current practice of withholding a defendant's prior record from juries to ensure a fair and equitable legal system.

question: Professional sportsmen and sportswomen and professional entertainers can often command enormous salaries today and this situation reflects society’s dependence on being entertained.To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: It is no secret that today’s entertainment industry is extremely popular, with nearly everyone being engaged at some time in watching TV shows, movies and sports games. The North American sports industry alone generates a massive $67.7 billion every year. With the present emphasis on entertainment, sportsmen and women and professional entertainers can earn enormous salaries, with figures in the millions for one game, appearance or film. This situation certainly does reflect today’s society’s obsession with entertainment.Many people argue that celebrities do not deserve such payment when work in other professions considered of equal or higher value to society is underpaid. A-list celebrities can make over $20 million per movie, whilst many average workers can barely make ends meet. Of course there are lots of people who say that there are better ways the money could be used, rather than allowing such a vast amount to go to just one person. This is a fairly naive point of view, though. So long as people wish to watch entertainment, advertising in turn will be present and the most watched celebrities will be able to earn high salaries, as their presence will ensure the high viewing figures the advertisers desire.Though celebrities and sportsmen and sportswomen often make very large sums of money, it can also be seen as unfair to say that they do not deserve it or propose their money be used for something else. While it is true that they did not find a cure for cancer or made a life-changing scientific discovery, their hard work and expertise created a product that the public wants to see and the high payment merely reflects their value.In conclusion, it is clear that today’s society is indeed a society obsessed with being entertained and the high salaries paid to those who entertain society clearly reflect this. The high payments, however, are not necessarily out of place or undeserved.
llm: The idea that professional athletes and entertainers can earn astronomical salaries due to society's reliance on entertainment is a widely discussed topic. I largely agree that this statement is accurate. The substantial incomes of celebrities and sports stars illustrate the high value society places on entertainment.On one side, the earnings of professional athletes and entertainers reflect the immense revenue generated by the entertainment industry. For example, elite footballers like Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi rake in tens of millions each year, not only from their clubs but also through lucrative endorsement deals. Similarly, top-tier actors such as Dwayne Johnson and Leonardo DiCaprio receive substantial fees for their film roles. The reason behind this is the vast number of fans willing to pay to watch them, whether on the field or the big screen. The combination of high demand for entertainment and the relatively limited number of exceptionally talented individuals drives these inflated salaries.Conversely, one could argue that such salaries are not entirely warranted and highlight a societal imbalance in values. For instance, essential workers like teachers and nurses, who play a vital role in society’s well-being, often receive modest pay. This discrepancy prompts us to question the true worth we assign to different professions and the influence of celebrity culture on our perceptions of value and success.In conclusion, while I recognize that the entertainment industry does generate substantial revenue and that extraordinary talent deserves appropriate compensation, I am also concerned about the stark contrast between the pay of entertainers and that of crucial professionals. While society's reliance on entertainment is undeniable, it is essential to reevaluate our priorities and ensure that we appropriately value and reward all professions based on their true contributions to society.

question: Providing a national system in a country where the unemployed receive a regular payment only encourages people not to seek work and puts an unreasonable strain on a country’s financial resources.Discuss this statement and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: In modern day society, money is a driving force for nearly everyone. Most people aspire to be financially secure and to have the ability to live the life they want. However, not everyone is able to find paid employment, and for that reason in some countries around the world, governments have initiated a system where the unemployed receive a regular payment to enable them to survive. Some people believe it is an excellent idea, whilst others believe that it is exhausting a country’s financial resources.When looking at the positive aspects of this system, it can be said that it prevents individuals from having a private bankruptcy. When somebody becomes unemployed, he or she will have on-going costs such as rent for a dwelling, bills for water, telephone and electricity as well as the cost of food and several other things. Without a salary, this person will fall into debt, because they will be unable to cover these expenses. A national unemployment payment system will therefore prevent this person from losing nearly everything over time. Without such system, many people would become homeless and would potentially engage in criminal activities to survive. Therefore, one can say that this system is positive. Although stories are heard of people exploiting the system, usually the newly unemployed want to find a job fast in order to become financially independent again, meaning that the government does not have to support them for long.Although there are positive aspects of this system, one can also say that if the payment made by the government is too high, it will prevent people from looking for work actively. Occasionally, the payment people receive is higher than their potential salaries, deterring them from working and creating an on-going cost for the government. A potential solution for this could be providing free training and employment support to open up new career opportunities with higher income, which would motivate this group to re-enter the workforce.In conclusion, the unemployment benefits system has positive and negative aspects. Personally, I believe that the positive effects of the system outweigh the negative. The payment must remain on a level that helps people survive without regular salaries, but does not seem attractive to exploit over a longer period of time.
llm: The idea that a national system of regular payments for the unemployed can demotivate job-seeking and strain a country's finances is a controversial topic. While some believe that such a system can create dependency and diminish the drive to work, the situation is more nuanced. In my view, a properly structured unemployment benefits system can serve as an essential safety net, aiding individuals during transitions between jobs rather than acting as a disincentive.It is indeed the case that excessively generous unemployment benefits can lessen the urgency to find work. If the payments are too high or extended for too long, they may lead to a culture of dependency, with individuals opting for government support instead of pursuing employment. Critics often highlight the elevated unemployment rates in certain European nations with comprehensive welfare systems as evidence of this phenomenon. However, it's important to understand that the connection between unemployment benefits and labor market participation is complex. Many people encounter considerable obstacles to employment, including skill deficits, limited job opportunities in their region, or health challenges, and during these times, benefits can be a crucial support.Conversely, a well-balanced unemployment benefits framework can actually enhance the job search process by allowing individuals the time needed to find suitable positions instead of hastily accepting any job due to financial pressure. This approach can result in better job placements, increased productivity, and ultimately contribute to a healthier economy. For instance, Denmark's flexicurity model integrates generous unemployment benefits with proactive labor market policies that promote job searching and offer training opportunities. This strategy has been linked to high employment rates and shorter unemployment spells, indicating that, when designed correctly, a national unemployment payment system can bolster rather than obstruct the labor market. Moreover, during economic downturns, unemployment benefits can act as automatic stabilizers, infusing cash into the economy and lessening the impact of recessions.In summary, although there are legitimate worries about the possibility of unemployment benefits discouraging work, a carefully designed system can significantly benefit both individuals and the economy as a whole. Instead of dismantling these systems, nations should concentrate on developing policies that balance support for the unemployed with incentives and resources to facilitate their return to work, ultimately fostering a more resilient and equitable labor market.

question: Public health is becoming an urgent issue nowadays. Some argue that governments should create nutrition and food choice laws to improve public health, while others believe that it is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Public health has become an increasingly pressing issue in the modern world, with many populations facing rising rates of obesity, diabetes, and other diet-related diseases. This has led to a debate as to whether governments should establish nutrition and food choice laws for the betterment of public health or if it solely falls on individuals to make wise choices. In my view, everyone should take ownership of their diet and assume responsibility for their health because it is the right choice.The argument for government-imposed nutrition and food choice laws is that they could help prevent people from making unhealthy choices which could lead to more serious illnesses down the line. For example, government regulations could limit the amount of sugar or fats allowed in food products, especially those marketed to children, and impose taxes on unhealthy snacks like chips and candy bars. This approach would also benefit those who lack the knowledge about healthy food, necessary to make informed decisions. By providing clear guidelines on what foods are healthy, and by taxing the unhealthy options higher, the government would steer individuals away from unhealthy options.However, there are also some valid arguments against governmental intervention. These types of regulations infringe upon individuals’ right to choose what they put in their bodies. After all, everyone should be free to make lifestyle choices for themselves. Additionally, there may not be enough evidence to suggest that overly restrictive regulations would have beneficial effects on public health outcomes in the long run. Since people’s love of unhealthy food is often considered an addiction, it is unlikely that a higher price or other warnings would be enough to deter individuals from purchasing unhealthy food items.In conclusion, while there can certainly be benefits associated with implementing nutrition and food choice laws at a governmental level, ultimately it should still come down to personal choice and responsibility as far as one’s diet is concerned. Governments should instead focus on providing citizens with better nutrition education, so that they can make better informed decisions about what they consume. This way, they can receive the information they need while still having autonomy over their own diets and lifestyles.
llm: In recent years, the topic of public health has gained significant attention, leading to debates about the role of government in encouraging healthy eating habits. On one side of the argument, some advocate for the implementation of laws governing nutrition and food choices to enhance public health. This could involve actions like limiting the availability of unhealthy foods and taxing sugary beverages and junk food. Supporters of this approach suggest that such regulations could decrease the prevalence of diet-related health issues, such as obesity and diabetes, resulting in a healthier society overall.Conversely, others argue that dietary choices should remain an individual's prerogative and responsibility. They contend that government intervention infringes on personal freedom, advocating instead for education and awareness initiatives as more effective means to foster healthy eating behaviors. From this perspective, individuals ought to have the autonomy to decide on their diets without government oversight.In my view, while individual responsibility and choice are crucial, governments also have a vital role in promoting public health. They can help create a supportive environment for healthy eating by subsidizing fresh produce and regulating the food industry to limit the aggressive marketing of unhealthy options. By employing a balanced strategy that integrates education, awareness, and regulatory measures, governments can enhance public health while respecting personal freedoms. Ultimately, addressing the complex challenges of public health requires a cooperative approach involving governments, individuals, and the food industry to cultivate a healthier society.

question: Reporting of crimes and other kinds of violent news on television and in newspapers can have adverse consquences. This kind of information should be restricted from being shown in the media. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: Reporting violent crimes and other violent issues could represents a adverse consequence sometimes. Overall, it is important to enphasyded that people are geting more and more violant and we can't blame only media as a mainly factor for those behavior.This kind of questions is almost a phylosical one and we will keeping this doubt for a long time, or even never now if people are becoming more agressive because they are more expousure to this kind of news, or if we are having more report regarding to violence just because people are getting more violent.I believe that people could feel estimulated to be a criminous person when they have a minimium certain that they won't be punish.For instance, stolen and other minimius crimes had increase at california region after they anounced that stolen under tham $1000 are consider a crime anymore. So the sensation that people could do anything wrong and that is no penalty for that, estimulates the number for stolen.In other hand, when we see some hardly rules the number of crime are dipest low, as we can see at Dubai, for instance. As all penalties are really hard and strongly implemented this place is considering highest safe.I bilieve that restricting any kind of information be showen in the media doesn't solve the problem, and, in fact, bring another new problem related to limited population information. When people know what are happening, type of crimes, etc, they could be prepare to handle with those problems and prevent theirselves.
llm: The coverage of crimes and violent incidents in the media has ignited a significant debate regarding its potential effects on society. While some contend that this type of reporting should be limited, I hold a nuanced perspective on the matter. On one hand, unrestricted broadcasting of violent news can have detrimental psychological effects on viewers, especially on children and those who are more vulnerable. Encountering graphic and distressing content may heighten feelings of fear and anxiety, as well as lead to desensitization toward violence. Additionally, an overemphasis on crime reporting can foster a culture of voyeurism, in which the public is drawn more to the sensational elements of a crime rather than examining the deeper social issues that contribute to such incidents.Conversely, imposing restrictions on the reporting of crimes and violent events could compromise the core tenets of a free press and the public’s right to information. The media plays an essential role in educating citizens about critical issues and holding authorities accountable. By covering crimes and violent events, journalists can shine a light on societal challenges, including crime statistics, police misconduct, or insufficient mental health resources. This exposure can stimulate public discourse, advocacy efforts, and, potentially, positive societal change. Moreover, responsible and well-rounded reporting can amplify the voices of victims and highlight available support services.In summary, while I recognize the possible negative outcomes of crime and violence reporting, I believe that an outright ban is not the answer. Instead, the media should focus on delivering responsible and balanced coverage that avoids sensationalism and graphic portrayals. By adopting this approach, the media can fulfill its obligation to inform the public while minimizing harm, ultimately fostering a more knowledgeable and compassionate society. A balanced method of reporting on crimes and violent news is essential to keep the public informed without inflicting distress.

question: Rich countries often give money to poorer countries, but it does not solve poverty. Therefore, developed countries should give other types of help to the poor countries rather than financial aid. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: Poverty represents a worldwide crisis. It is the ugliest epidemic in a region, which could infect countries in the most debilitating ways. To tackle this issue, rich countries need to help those in need and give a hand when possible. I agree that there are several ways of aiding poor countries other than financial aid, like providing countries in need with engineers, workers, and soldiers who would build infrastructure. Building universities, hospitals, and roadways. By having a solid infrastructure, poor countries would be able to monetise their profits and build a stronger and more profitable economy which would help them in the long term. Once unprivilged countries find their niche, the major hurdle would be passed and would definitely pave the way for much brighter future. However, I do disagree that financial aid does not solve poverty, it does if used properly and efficiently. The most determining factor if financial aid would be the way to go, is by identifying what type of poor countries' representative are dealing with. Some countries will have a responsible leader and some will not, with that being said, implementing a strategy, to distinguish responsible leaders from others, would tailor the type of aid rich countries could use. An example, A clear report and constant observation would be applied to track the progress and how this type of aid is being monetized. In summary, types of aid varies from country to another, and tailoring the type of aid is of paramount importance to solve this problem that had huge toll on poor countries.
llm: The idea that financial aid from wealthier nations fails to significantly reduce poverty has ignited a discussion about the most effective types of assistance. While some believe developed countries should prioritize alternative forms of aid, I partially concur with this view.On one hand, financial aid can fall short in tackling the underlying causes of poverty. It is often susceptible to mismanagement or misuse by corrupt governments, and may foster a culture of dependency rather than promoting self-reliance. Additionally, non-monetary assistance, such as knowledge transfer, technology, and education, can lead to deeper and more sustainable improvements in a nation's development. For example, implementing training and skill-building programs can empower local communities to stimulate their own economic progress and lessen their dependence on external help.On the other hand, financial aid remains vital in urgent situations or for certain developmental initiatives. During natural disasters or humanitarian emergencies, prompt financial support is essential to save lives and provide essential services. Moreover, strategically allocated financial aid can bolster critical infrastructure development—such as constructing schools, hospitals, or roads—that are fundamental to a nation's long-term growth.In summary, while I support the idea that developed nations should consider offering other forms of assistance, such as technical support and capacity-building programs, either in addition to or in lieu of financial aid, I do not believe we should completely dismiss the value of financial help. A balanced approach that merges financial support with various assistance types—customized to the unique circumstances and needs of each developing nation—will likely yield the most effective outcomes in combating poverty and fostering sustainable development. Ultimately, there is no universal remedy; a sophisticated strategy that embraces diverse forms of aid is essential to making a genuine impact in the battle against poverty.

question: Schools should select students by their academic abilities, agree or disagree?
human: Some people think that schools should select students according to their academic abilities, while others believe that it is better to have students with different abilities studying together. Discuss both views and state your own opinion.Some people contend that mixed ability classes are more beneficial for children’s development than streaming them on the basis of judgement about their academic abilities. However, from my perspective, I disagree with this contention.Admittedly, mixed ability classes provide a better environment for children’s all-round development. In such classes, children with different abilities study together and in turn they can learn from one another. From example, a student, who is good at academic study but weak in dancing or painting, can learn how to dance or paint his peers. In this sense, mixed ability classes allow students to develop their abilities in different subjects instead of only academic abilities.Despite the argument above, I believe streaming students brings more benefits to teachers and students. As for teachers, separating children with better academic abilities from others facilitates effective teaching. This practice helps teachers to control their students more conveniently and easily. Compared with mixed ability in which teacher should consider students’ differences when they are using teaching methodologies, streaming makes this situation simpler. To be more specific, students are at the same level of academic ability in a class, and in turn teachers can use the same methodologies for them all. In this way, the narrower the spread of ability in the class, the more convenient the teaching can be.On top of this, enables students to learn in an effective way. According to students’ different abilities, they are taught in different ways that are more suitable for them. In the top streams, students use more difficult materials, therefore, they can learn more. In sharp contrast, teachers can explain the material more slowly to those in bottom streams. Under this circumstance, students with different academic abilities can study effectively and efficiently.In the final analysis, mixed ability classes are beneficial for students’ versatile development, but in my opinion, segregating students based on different academic ability is better for both teachers and students.The writer presented a balanced discussion of the topic, effortlessly delivered in a form of a fluent, well-written IELTS essay. The arguments and reasoning are laid out in a coherent, logical way. A wide range of vocabulary is used in this work. There are very few spelling errors that could have been caught in an additional round of proofreading (mouse over the words underlined in blue shows corrections). Keep up the good work! Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.
llm: The debate surrounding whether schools should choose students based on their academic skills has been ongoing for quite some time. Proponents argue that such selection can create a more effective learning atmosphere, while opponents believe it can result in social and emotional challenges. Personally, I am opposed to the idea of schools selecting students based on academic prowess.Choosing students based on their academic performance risks fostering a narrow and elitist educational model. This could lead to students who are less academically inclined being assigned to lower-quality schools or programs, which can severely damage their self-esteem and motivation. It may also result in a system where students are confined to specific categories, constraining their potential and growth opportunities.Additionally, selecting students based on their academic abilities can further entrench social inequalities. Students from underprivileged backgrounds often face a lack of access to essential resources and opportunities, placing them at a significant disadvantage in the selection process. Consequently, this can lead to a scenario where students from wealthier families are disproportionately chosen for elite schools, worsening pre-existing social and economic disparities.Instead of focusing on academic selection, the education system should emphasize creating inclusive and supportive learning environments that address the diverse needs of all students. This includes implementing strategies that advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion, such as mixed-ability classrooms and individualized learning plans. By adopting these approaches, schools can offer a more comprehensive education that prepares students for success in all areas of life, not solely in academics. Ultimately, the purpose of education should be to equip students with the skills, knowledge, and support necessary to realize their full potential, irrespective of their academic abilities.

question: Scientists believe that the world is in danger due to environmental changes. Some people say that personal lifestyle changes should be made to reduce the damage to environment, while others think that the government should do something to help. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
human: Environmental problems are clearly something that is often discussed in today’s world. One part of the society claims that individuals should change their habits and lifestyle to improve the ecological situation. Others, on the other hand, believe that this issue should be solved on the governmental level. This essay will discuss both sides of the argument and my perspective will be offered.It is hard to deny that human kind is responsible for the current environmental situation, and it seems impossible to achieve any noticeable result in this field without the participation of vast majority of individuals. For instance, a simple lifestyle change such as introducing the separation of household rubbish can make recycling projects more convenient and efficient. Moreover, consumers can reduce their usage of plastic items and, in turn, less plastic waste will contaminate the environment.However, many people still feel that the government has more tools to prevent environmental changes. One option that the authorities have is to discourage citizens from using personal vehicles by charging high taxes and additional fees. Moreover, politicians usually have access to resources to educate people about environmental problems and promote the most important ecological projects on all levels, ranging from special courses at schools to TV shows and websites related to this topic. Furthermore, it is a key responsibility of the government to protect the environment by spending state funds on research and modern equipment. Countries where legislation protects the ecology, for example Norway, have achieved visible results and overcame most environmental problems.In conclusion, I believe that a combined approach will work best to prevent or reverse environmental changes. A contribution of every individual is just as important as the intervention from the government in order to fix existing issues and save our planet for future generations.
llm: The world is currently grappling with a critical challenge stemming from environmental changes, as highlighted by scientists. The ongoing debate about the most effective strategies for addressing this issue has led to a passionate discussion between those advocating for personal lifestyle changes and those arguing for the necessity of government intervention.Advocates of personal lifestyle changes argue that individual actions can have a meaningful impact on reducing environmental harm. Simple initiatives such as cutting down on plastic usage, utilizing public transportation, and recycling can collectively yield significant benefits when adopted by a broad audience. Additionally, these personal changes can raise awareness and inspire others to join the movement, potentially leading to a grassroots approach to sustainability.Conversely, many contend that government action is essential in tackling environmental challenges. Governments possess the authority to create and enforce policies that can dramatically decrease pollution and waste on a larger scale compared to individual efforts. For example, they can impose stricter regulations on industries, invest in renewable energy sources, and launch comprehensive campaigns to promote sustainable behaviors across the population.I believe that the most effective strategy for addressing environmental changes lies in a blend of personal lifestyle adjustments and government action. While individual efforts can certainly contribute to the solution, they often have limited reach and influence. On the other hand, governmental intervention can establish the necessary infrastructure and resources to confront environmental issues on both national and global levels. Thus, it is vital for individuals to make informed lifestyle choices, while governments must implement and uphold policies aimed at safeguarding our planet for future generations.

question: Senior managers should have higher salaries than other employees (agree/disagree)
human: In many countries senior positions have higher salaries compared to those of young workers of the same company. Some people think this isn’t justified. Do you agree or disagree?While some believe that rewarding those in managerial positions with higher pay packets is appropriate, not everyone agrees with this view. Personally, I am leaning towards the latter position due to negative impacts caused by significant difference in salaries within a company.For one, executive officers should know that higher than sufficient salaries are not necessary. Indeed, the higher the remuneration they receive, the more likely the company to suffer from devoid of financial capability. Furthermore, they often gain powers that money can’t buy. For instance, they often make important decisions over how to make their company thrive. They are also entitled to allocate company’s budget and designate tasks to other workers. these non-financial entitlements, they should refrain from earning more than reasonable amounts as salaries.Unreasonably high salaries granted to the executives can also afflict other employees. In fact, it is foreseeable that many employees would feel powerless or even when they find out about the huge salary gap between the executive officers’ and theirs. Accordingly, some may leave the company, and others may go on to strike and demand a pay increase. However, those actions . Therefore, unfair salary systems like this would yield unhealthy working environment for both employers and employees.In conclusion, I oppose to those in managerial roles with obscene amounts of compensation because it can cost the company its prosperity and discourage other employees . Thus it is recommended for the company to decide on the salaries of executive officers and general workers by adopting a more motivating salary system.This is a good example of an IELTS Band 8 essay. The task statement is sufficiently discussed, and the writer’s arguments are relevant and well developed. There are only 2 body paragraphs, but they are coherent and help to organise the information. Linking words are used appropriately to sequence ideas. Skillful use of synonyms throughout the essay demonstrates the writer’s vocabulary. Some of the expressions used aren’t entirely suitable or accurate, but there aren’t many of them. Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.0.
llm: I believe that senior managers should earn higher salaries than other employees. This is primarily due to the substantial responsibilities they carry within an organization, including making strategic decisions, managing departments, and driving business growth. Their roles usually demand a high level of expertise, strong leadership skills, and the ability to navigate complex and high-pressure situations.One key reason for senior managers’ higher salaries is their significant impact on the organization's success. Their decisions and leadership play a crucial role in influencing the company’s profitability, growth, and competitive stance in the marketplace. Therefore, their compensation should reflect the value they contribute to the organization. Offering higher salaries can also incentivize senior managers to perform at their best, encouraging them to make choices that align with the company’s long-term objectives.Additionally, senior managers often hold advanced degrees and possess extensive experience, which require significant time and financial investment to attain. Their elevated salaries recognize this investment and are essential for attracting and retaining top talent in executive roles, particularly given the competitive nature of the job market for senior management positions.Moreover, a salary hierarchy within a company is a conventional and rational structure that acknowledges varying levels of responsibility and contribution. Junior employees benefit from the guidance and support of their senior counterparts, and as they advance in their careers and take on increased responsibilities, their compensation should also rise accordingly. This system not only motivates employees to aspire for higher positions but also fosters a sense of fairness and progression within the organization.In summary, due to their substantial responsibilities, the requirement for advanced skills and experience, and the need to accurately reflect the value they bring to the organization, senior managers should indeed receive higher salaries than other employees. This not only serves as motivation and recognition but also is an essential part of the organizational structure that aligns rewards with responsibilities and performance.

question: Should employers pay more attention to personal qualities rather than qualifications?
human: While recruiting a new employee, the employer should pay more attention to their personal qualities, rather than qualifications and experience. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Give your opinion and include relevant examples.Recent decades have witnessed a burgeoning growth of numerous industries; therefore, recruiting the right person for the position is crucial to the development of enterprises. But how do we determine if a person is the best fit? Advocates of conventional recruitment methods opine that this candidate must have sufficient experience and qualifications needed for that job. Nevertheless, some people argue that candidates’ personal qualities cannot be ignored. In my view, both components are of equal importance.To begin with, the conventional approach of checking potential workers’ qualifications via their resumes, LinkedIn profiles, issued qualifications and certifications from authorised organisations is vital. Apparently, whenever we submit a job application, we are always required to attach a CV while a cover letter is optional. Without a decent qualification, even if that candidate’s personal characteristics are suitable, the enterprise will need to carry out lots of skill trainings eventually.On the other hand, occasionally during an interview some HR officers ignore the significance of assessing how candidates’ individual qualities can fit in the company. Employers should assess not only candidates’ qualifications but also their enabling skills, ethics and value propositions. The more an employee’s personal qualities fit in a company’s culture and values, the more he or she is motivated to contribute to that company’s vision. KPMG is a great example of evaluating candidates’ personal qualifications and skills by utilising a game-based assessment process, followed by a video interview. This methodology enables a comprehensive assessment, and is embraced by many companies nowadays.To summarise, employers should assess both personal characteristics and formal qualifications when recruiting people as each of these elements has its own vital contribution to make in talent-seeking enterprises.This response covers the topic well. The writer’s position is clearly expressed and supported by an example, the use of paragraphing makes this essay organised and easy to follow. Linking words are used appropriately. The use of complex sentences and advanced vocabulary is impressive. Overall, this essay is likely to score Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: The discussion around whether employers should emphasize personal attributes over formal qualifications has gained considerable traction in recent years. While qualifications are frequently regarded as a vital measure of a candidate's potential to succeed in a role, there's a growing argument that personal traits such as teamwork, communication skills, and adaptability hold equal or even greater significance.Qualifications offer a glimpse into a candidate’s academic and technical prowess, but they often fall short of capturing their personality, work ethic, or collaborative abilities. A highly qualified candidate might find it challenging to work well in a team or convey complex ideas to colleagues and clients. Conversely, an individual with strong personal attributes—such as empathy, resilience, and a positive outlook—might excel in learning and adapting, despite lacking formal qualifications.Moreover, placing a greater emphasis on personal qualities can contribute to a more diverse and inclusive workforce. By broadening their criteria beyond qualifications, employers can attract candidates from unconventional backgrounds, who can introduce unique perspectives and experiences to the organization. This can drive innovation, creativity, and effective problem-solving, ultimately leading to better business outcomes.In summary, while qualifications are undeniably important, employers should focus more on personal qualities when making hiring decisions. This approach enables the formation of a team that is not only skilled and knowledgeable but also motivated, adaptable, and capable of collaborating seamlessly. Such a strategy can enhance job satisfaction, lower turnover rates, and boost productivity, benefiting both employers and employees alike. It is time for employers to reassess their hiring practices and prioritize those personal traits that truly distinguish a candidate.

question: Should people spend a lot on weddings and birthday parties?
human: Some people think that spending a lot on holding wedding parties, birthday parties and other celebrations is just a waste of money. Others, however, think that these are necessary for individuals and the society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Throwing parties can be expensive. While some people do not find these fancy gatherings worth what they cost, others believe such events are important to both individuals and the society.People choose to throw parties for a number of reasons. For starters, they can make better teams. Project kick-off parties are good opportunities to break the ice and help team members to know each other better. Celebrating a victory create a sense of success and belonging. Companies do not see parties as of money and allocate budget to support such events; moreover, they often leave good memories. From our own experiences, we all have happy memories of our birthday parties when we were little. Every family has great photos at family gatherings in their album. In addition, contrary to what some people believe that spending on parties is a waste of social resources, they actually create value, either by employing people in the party-planning business or by offering people better experiences.The popularity of parties, however, causes some tension in the society. They are hard on introverted people who find themselves uncomfortable in the crowd. This is a clinic symptom which psychologists call “social anxiety disorder”. There are other ways to celebrate important events that may have greater value for their cost. For instance, companies could send out gifts after successful projects and parents could take their children on family trips to celebrate birthdays.In my opinion, while a party is a form of social event that brings many benefits to individuals and the society, other choices should also be considered, either to cut spending or to relieve the stress of those who are not fond of crowded celebrations.This is a very good essay. Other than minor inaccuracies there are no problems (mouse over the words underlined in blue shows corrections). Seems to be worth IELTS Band 8.
llm: The debate surrounding the expenditure on weddings and birthday parties is complex. Some contend that these significant milestones are unique events warranting extravagant celebrations. A lavish wedding or birthday bash can forge enduring memories for the individual and their guests, and it also serves as a way to express love, respect, and appreciation for the person being honored. In various cultures, opulent weddings and birthdays are seen as indicators of social status, leading many to feel compelled to invest heavily to uphold their societal image.Conversely, there are those who believe that spending excessively on such celebrations is not only unnecessary but also wasteful. The funds allocated for these occasions might be better spent on more practical matters like saving for the future, paying off debts, or contributing to charitable causes. Moreover, extravagant celebrations can place financial burdens on the hosts, resulting in stress and debt that can have lasting repercussions. The societal pressure to lavish money on these events can lead to anxiety, detracting from the genuine enjoyment and meaning of the celebration.In summary, while the desire to celebrate special moments beautifully is understandable, it is essential to approach the decision to spend significantly on weddings and birthday parties with a careful evaluation of one’s financial circumstances and priorities. A more balanced approach might involve marking these occasions in a way that is both meaningful and enjoyable while remaining responsible and sustainable. This could mean establishing a realistic budget, prioritizing what truly matters, and emphasizing the joy and love of the celebration over the monetary aspects.

question: Should the same laws which prohibit the sale and consumption of heroin be applied to tobacco? Discuss.
human: Recently, a heated debate when a few reputable health organizations suggested the application of a similar act of heroin selling and usage prohibition . In this , I will analyze why the adoption of such a law could be a breakthrough in our youngsters’ safety, according to my vision.Firstly, tobacco does not differ much from heroin when it comes to the addictive effect. , the active ingredient in tobacco, exerts its effect by acting directly on smoker’s brain cells. Numerous experiments carried out by on animals, rats, proved that this toxic chemical does lead time to dependency, similarly to the effect experienced with .Secondly, the restriction on selling would surely show an instant decline in tobacco smoking. ” Having easy access to cigarettes puts a tremendous pressure, especially on teenagers,to resist such a temptation” Dr.Hisham , head of department at Alexandria Medical college , states firmly. “Giving the new generation the sense that the severity of smoking is to other lethal drugs usage be a life saving step, they will thank us for as they get older.” he continues.To recapitulate, applying of a futuristic law such as the suggested one will have a positive impact ,not only on young people’s health but on our society as a whole.
llm: The issue of applying laws that ban the sale and use of heroin to tobacco is complex and contentious. On one side, both heroin and tobacco are substances that carry significant health risks. Tobacco is particularly notorious, causing millions of deaths every year worldwide due to smoking-related diseases such as lung cancer and heart disease.
