In summary, history is an invaluable source of wisdom that enhances our understanding of the human experience. I wholeheartedly believe that we can draw important lessons from the past to improve our lives today.

question: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military, while others disagree (opinion)
human: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military. Others think that women are less suitable for this kind of job. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Sample EssayIn recent years gender equality in employment has been the topic of heated debate. While some may argue that women are less suited for certain jobs such as with the police or the military, I believe that female candidates should be treated the same as their male counterparts.Those who consider women to be unsuited for some kinds of jobs including the police or the military often hold that opinion because such jobs are extremely physically demanding. As the female body has smaller muscles and less physical strength compared to male body, women may have difficulty engaging in strenuous activity which can be exhausting even for men. In military service, female soldiers are more likely to struggle while defending themselves than their male peers when they are forced to move around carrying heavy firearms in the battle, which can increase their risk of mission failure. Because of the hazards and extreme conditions they may encounter, some people advocate that women are not suitable for work in these fields.Nevertheless, I believe that female applicants should be considered for police or military placements without a gender bias, because women are more suited to certain tasks. In the police service, female officers can perform important roles on some occasions such as a body search where male officers are restricted from touching female convicts. In the military service, female nursing staff are more likely to care better for injured soldiers since maternal instinct makes them dedicated and heart-warming professionals. Furthermore, for the sake of fairness to all, job seekers should have an equal opportunity to choose their jobs freely, regardless of gender. Many women have the desire to work in the police and the military and some of them have relevant expertise and qualifications. Therefore, they should not be discriminated against in employment opportunities for these jobs.In conclusion, although some say that women are incompatible with police and military duties because of the high physical demands, I believe that they should be treated as equal to men. This is because there are certain roles with the police and the military that are more suitable for women than men, and therefore both genders should have equal employment opportunities.
llm: The issue of equal treatment for women in police and military roles has been a topic of intense debate for many years. Advocates for equality argue that women should have the same job opportunities as men in these sectors, asserting that women possess similar capabilities and strengths. This viewpoint is rooted in the principle of gender equality, which asserts that women deserve the same rights and opportunities as men in all areas of life, including employment.Conversely, some opponents of this notion contend that certain roles in law enforcement and the military necessitate a level of physical strength and endurance that may not be compatible with women. They also voice concerns regarding the safety and welfare of female officers in high-pressure situations. However, such arguments often reflect outdated stereotypes about women's abilities and overlook the numerous women who have demonstrated exceptional competence and courage in these fields.In truth, women have made considerable contributions to law enforcement and military services, enhancing the effectiveness and diversity of these institutions. A commitment to treating women as equals allows these organizations to access a broader array of talent and skills, resulting in improved outcomes and more comprehensive decision-making. Moreover, ensuring equal treatment for women in these sectors is not just a matter of justice; it also serves as a catalyst for advancing gender equality throughout society.In summary, the belief that women should be treated as equals to men in law enforcement and military job applications is anchored in principles of fairness, equality, and an acknowledgment of women’s capabilities. It is crucial to confront and dismantle the stereotypes and biases that limit women’s participation in these areas, fostering an environment where women can serve with dignity and respect. By doing this, we can enhance these institutions and promote a more equitable society.

question: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research (discuss)
human: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research for the benefit of human beings, while others argue that it is wrong. Discuss both views and give your opinion.People have different views on how medical research should be conducted and tested. Although many people support the use of for developing medicines, I personally believe that animal testing is morally wrong.The main reason why some people value to conduct medical research is because animal testing has contributed to many life-saving cures and treatments. It is true that nearly every medical breakthrough in the last 100 years has resulted directly from research using animals. For example, experiments in which dogs had their pancreases removed led directly to the discovery of insulin, critical to saving the lives of diabetics. Furthermore, it is impossible to release to the market before proving it no harm to humans and laboratory mice are appropriate research subjects because they are similar to human beings in many ways.However, I people who consider medical development that involved the use of animals cruel and unacceptable. I believe that the lives of all creatures should be respected and we, humans, have no right to for our own benefits. Governments should invest in developing alternative methods that can replace when doing medical research. For example, a software program can be developed to model a human immune system and new drugs can be tested on the software rather than animals. In this way, no animals will suffer from the medical tests and the society can still benefit from medical development.In conclusion, although it is undoubtedly true that animal testing has helped scientists in drug developments and medical discoveries, I believe that the benefits to humans do not justify the suffering caused to animals and we should use alternative methods when doing medical research that do not involve animals suffering.This is a great essay. It addresses the two sides of the argument by exploring reasons why animals should and should not be used in medical research. The ideas are well explained and supported by examples. The use of paragraphing is efficient and helps with logical sequencing of ideas. Linking words are used appropriately to achieve the necessary cohesion. Author’s meaning is skillfully conveyed by the use of wide range of vocabulary. Even though there are some inaccurately used expressions, they don’t hinder understanding. Most sentences are error-free, instances of faulty grammar are rare. Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.
llm: The role of animals in medical research has been a contentious issue for many years. Supporters of animal research contend that it is essential for the progression of human health and medicine. They point out that animal testing has contributed to significant medical advancements, such as the development of vaccines, antibiotics, and cancer therapies.Conversely, there are strong opponents of animal research who raise ethical and moral objections. They assert that animals are sentient beings capable of experiencing pain and suffering, and therefore, using them for research purposes infringes on their rights. These critics also highlight the availability of alternative methods, like computer simulations and in vitro testing, which could serve as effective substitutes for animal testing.Nonetheless, advocates of animal testing argue that these alternatives are not yet advanced enough to fully replace the need for animals in research. They maintain that animal models are vital for assessing the safety and effectiveness of new drugs and treatments, and argue that the overall benefits of animal research outweigh the associated costs. Additionally, many researchers emphasize that animal testing is conducted under strict regulations, ensuring the welfare of the animals involved.In summary, while there are compelling arguments on both sides, it is undeniable that animal testing has played a crucial role in medical advancements. It is equally important to consider the ethical dilemmas associated with this practice and to continue seeking alternative methods. Ultimately, a balanced approach that weighs both the benefits and drawbacks of animal testing is essential for conducting medical research responsibly and humanely. Such an approach can help advance human health while also striving to reduce animal suffering.

question: Some people feel that entertainers such as film stars, pop musicians or sports stars are paid too much money.Do you agree or disagree?Which other types of job should be highly paid?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Jobs such as actors, musicians or athlete earns a lot of money, however, a part of people argued that these kinds of people are overpaid. In my opinion, I disagree with this view and believes that they deserved the high salary.People who works as a movie stars, musicians and sports player deserved high money paid. This is because they advocated all there time and effort to get the salary that they have today. Before they become famous, they only have few incomes or even get nothing. That is to say, many musicians did not get any payment at the begining of their career, so do the actors and sports players, they spent their time but do not get any money. For instance, before being a well-known musicians, they have to spend their own money on buying equipment to produce musics or to public the songs they have made. Also, the creativety and their works cannot be measured by money. Thus, they deserved high salary because of their profession and uncopyable works.Jobs which needs professional skills and the job envolves high risk shoul also be highly paid. Such as doctors and programmers, their job are unplaceable because these envolved professional knowledge that not everyone had. Moreover, people works in high-risk environment deserved high payment too. For example, fire-fighters, they might got hurt or even die while working. Therefore, higher salary is needed for jobs that need special skills and career with high risk.To sum up, I agree with the statement because of the reasons above, and jobs with special knowledge and people works in dangerous environment should also be highly paid.
llm: The debate over whether entertainers, including film stars, musicians, and athletes, are overpaid is a contentious one. Personally, I believe these individuals often receive excessive compensation for their work. The amounts they earn can be astronomical, with some celebrities raking in tens of millions of dollars annually. Although they provide joy and entertainment to countless people, their salaries appear disproportionate to the value they offer.In contrast, there are many professions that are crucial to society yet remain underpaid and undervalued. For example, teachers, nurses, and social workers play vital roles in our communities’ well-being, yet they receive relatively meager salaries. These dedicated professionals devote their lives to educating, healing, and supporting vulnerable populations, and their efforts directly influence the quality of life for many.Additionally, professions that demand extensive education, skill, and risk—such as those of doctors, engineers, and firefighters—also deserve higher compensation. These individuals undergo rigorous training and often face danger to ensure public safety and deliver essential services. For instance, doctors dedicate many years to become specialists, and their expertise is critical for saving lives and enhancing healthcare outcomes.In summary, while entertainers do add value to our lives, their high salaries seem excessive in comparison to professions that make significant contributions to the greater good. It is crucial to reassess our priorities and acknowledge the importance of jobs that have a tangible impact, such as those in education, healthcare, and public service. By doing so, we can work towards a fairer compensation system that truly reflects the value created by various professions.

question: Some people feel that fashion is like art and a significant part of society, while others feel that fashion is a waste of time and money.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The fashion industry today is an important component of society and people’s lives. It is true that many people care little for clothes and scorn the importance that others attach to them; however, this does not mean that the significance that people give to fashion is a waste of time and money.When one considers that areas of the world suffer from poverty, disease and inadequate access to food and clean water, the emphasis attached to fashion by the developed world can seem out of proportion. Many people would contend that the resources put into developing and creating fashion would be more ethically spent on creating some level of equality in terms of the right to live a healthy and happy life. This point is hard to argue with. However, it is also true that people in the developed world cannot be expected to send all their spending money to people in need and that wanting to look good is an unalterable human trait.The fashion industry contributes to the society much like most other industries. It provides jobs and income to millions of people around the world and the money that changes hands generates taxes that contribute to the fabric of society. There is more to fashion than trying to look better than others and excessive luxury. The high level of fashion is indeed a kind of art form and, like other art forms, there will always be people who appreciate it, want to create it and want to spend money on it. It is part of the development of civilisation and this is not likely to change.I therefore feel that, although the gap between the rich and the poor sometimes makes it seem that fashion is a waste of time and money and an unethical use of resources, fashion is an important part of today’s society and economic output. This leads me to believe that trying to strike a balance between selfish greed and a more altruistic way of living should be an individual choice.
llm: The discussion surrounding the role of fashion in society has been ongoing, with some people perceiving it as a vital form of art and an essential facet of culture, while others dismiss it as a trivial misuse of time and resources. Proponents of fashion as an art form argue that it serves as a medium for individual creativity and personal expression. Fashion designers are comparable to artists, utilizing fabrics, colors, and textures to craft works that evoke feelings and convey important messages. Moreover, the fashion industry significantly impacts the economy by creating jobs and generating substantial revenue. A prime example is the Met Gala, a notable fashion event that not only celebrates style but also serves as a stage for fundraising and spotlighting social issues.Conversely, detractors argue that fashion is a superficial and materialistic endeavor that prompts individuals to value appearance over substance. They claim that the relentless pursuit of the latest trends fosters needless consumerism and waste, which exacerbates environmental issues and social disparities. Additionally, the fashion industry frequently faces criticism for its shortcomings in diversity and inclusivity, alongside its role in upholding unrealistic beauty standards.From my perspective, fashion represents more than just a mere societal distraction. Although the industry has its shortcomings, I maintain that fashion can serve as a potent means of self-expression, cultural interaction, and social critique. When approached responsibly, fashion has the potential to advocate for sustainability, diversity, and body positivity. Brands like Patagonia and Reformation exemplify this shift toward eco-conscious and ethical practices. Furthermore, fashion has been utilized to raise awareness about pressing social matters, such as the "Pink Ribbon" campaign for breast cancer awareness. In summary, despite the legitimate criticisms directed at the fashion industry, I believe its artistic and cultural significance, alongside its capacity for positive social impact, renders it an important and valuable aspect of society.

question: Some people feel that learning a foreign language is an essential component of a child’s education. Others feel that learning a foreign language is often a waste of time that can be better spent on learning about technology and other more vocational subjects.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: Throughout the history of education, learning a foreign language or languages has been a constant component. Of course, many people feel that this is really an unnecessary part of education for everyone, but this is not a point of view that I share.The opponents to learning a foreign language might argue that most people do not travel that often outside their own country. In addition to this, out of all the countries of the world, comparatively not many share the same language. Therefore, learning a foreign language will only be useful for the very limited time that one spends in a country where this language is used. For some people, the language might never be used in their entire lives. When one thinks about how much time and money are spent training language teachers, buying resources, going on trips and delivering lessons for such a negligible benefit, this would seem to be a very inefficient allocation of resources.However, the benefits of learning a foreign language go further than just the ability to use it from time to time on a holiday or business trip. Firstly, through learning one language, one gains an understanding to some extent of how all languages work. Thus, no matter where people might end up around the world, the knowledge of language can be of use. Secondly, with the study of a foreign language, one also opens oneself up to other cultures. This allows in turn an appreciation for different points of view and belief systems. With an ever-shrinking world due to globalisation, the ability to empathise and understand the people from other countries is vital to reducing conflict and creating a more tolerant society. Finally, quite simply learning languages is excellent for the improvement of general cognitive skills.It seems to me that learning a foreign language, therefore, is more than just gaining the ability to speak a few words of a foreign tongue. It is part of intellectual and social development and needs to be continued for everyone in today’s schools.
llm: The discussion about the significance of foreign language learning in children's education has ignited vigorous debate. Some argue that mastering a foreign language is an essential part of a child's educational experience. They contend that it not only expands their cultural awareness but also enhances their career prospects in an ever-globalizing world. For example, a child fluent in multiple languages can interact effectively with individuals from various backgrounds, fostering international connections and collaborations. Additionally, studies indicate that learning a foreign language can boost cognitive abilities since it engages memory, attention, and problem-solving skills.Conversely, some people believe that learning a foreign language is an inefficient use of time, which could be better allocated to subjects like technology and vocational training. They suggest that in today's digital landscape, where translation apps and artificial intelligence are commonly available, the necessity of learning a foreign language is waning. Furthermore, they argue that disciplines such as coding, computer science, and engineering offer more practical and sought-after skills that can secure a child's future employment.In my view, I firmly believe that learning a foreign language is a vital aspect of a child's education. While technology has indeed progressed significantly, human interaction and cultural exchange remain invaluable in any field. A foreign language is not merely a tool for communication; it serves as a gateway to new cultures, histories, and perspectives. For instance, a student proficient in Spanish can not only engage with Spanish speakers but also appreciate the rich cultural traditions of Spain and Latin America. Moreover, as international cooperation and diplomacy become increasingly crucial, the ability to converse in multiple languages becomes a significant asset. Consequently, I assert that learning a foreign language should be a priority in a child's education, as it can unlock a wealth of experiences, cultures, and opportunities that profoundly shape their future.

question: Some people feel that the design of newly constructed buildings in big cities should be controlled by governments. Others believe those who finance the construction of a building should be free to design it as they see fit.Discuss both these views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is often argued that governments should involve in construction's design in huge cities, while others argued that governments do not have to retrict the free of designers' imagination if those designs are splendid fit on the cities. I believe that if that were to happen, it would be the positive development. This essay will highlight the both views and give personal opinion from the former argument's side.To begin with latter opinion, although governments have worried about the combination of buildings entirely, the strong limitation about design can cause squandering of designers' skills. There are huge number of competitions about designing building in this society, and the evolution in these fields has developed dramatically. However, if there is a strict criteria on design of building, the majority of intelligences do not need to hammer away to come up with revolutional outline for building.On the other hand, signitured design of the big cities by itself can be the purpose of trevelling as a landmark, and it can be followed by significant economical achievement in the country. To take myself as an example, in 2017, I went to Gold Coast for study automotive engineering, and I was stunnied becaused of the atmosphere which is formed by combination of similar buildings and beach. Furthermore, according to the research from Sydney university, Gold Coast is one of the cities which make a fortune because of marvelous view.To sum up with, I would therefore argue that in spite of the fact that building design restriction can influence on architects negatively, it has a potential ability to make a significant profit in the future.
llm: The ongoing debate regarding who should oversee the design of new buildings in major cities has led to a heated discussion. On one side, some advocate for government involvement in building design to preserve aesthetic consistency and ensure that new structures align with the city’s master plan. This approach aims to prevent the erection of unsightly buildings that could disrupt the city’s visual harmony. For example, Paris enforces strict building regulations to maintain its historical charm and character.Conversely, others argue that those financing construction projects should be free to design as they wish. This viewpoint values creativity and innovation in architecture, allowing developers to produce distinctive and iconic buildings that mirror the city’s diversity. A prime example is the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, Spain, designed by Frank Gehry, which exemplifies the impact of unrestricted architectural creativity, attracting millions of visitors and enhancing the local economy.In my view, a balanced strategy is essential. Governments should implement regulations to ensure buildings meet safety and environmental standards while also permitting developers the flexibility to exercise their creativity. This could be achieved through adaptable zoning laws and incentives for innovative and sustainable designs. Ultimately, fostering collaboration among governments, developers, and architects can lead to the development of aesthetically pleasing, functional, and sustainable buildings that enrich the urban experience and support the city’s growth. By finding a balance between oversight and creative freedom, cities can evolve into vibrant and dynamic centers that celebrate human ingenuity and advancement.

question: Some people feel that with the rise of artificial intelligence, computers and robots will take over the roles of teachers. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: With ever increasing technological advances, computers and robots are replacing human roles in different areas of society. This trend can also be seen in education, where interactive programs can enhance the educational experience for children and young adults. Whether, however, this revolution can also take over the role of the teacher completely is debatable, and I oppose this idea as it is unlikely to serve students well.The roles of computers and robots can be seen in many areas of the workplace. Classic examples are car factories, where a lot of the repetitive precision jobs done on assembly lines have been performed by robots for many years, and medicine, where diagnosis, and treatment, including operations, have also been assisted by computers for a long time. According to the media, it won’t also be long until we have cars that are driven automatically.It has long been discussed whether robots and computers can do this in education. It is well known that the complexity of programs can now adapt to so many situations that something can already be set up that has the required knowledge of the teacher, along with the ability to predict and answer all questions that might be asked by students. In fact, due to the nature of computers, the knowledge levels can far exceed a teacher’s and have more breadth, as a computer can have equal knowledge in all the subjects that are taught in school, as opposed to a single teacher’s specialisation. It seems very likely, therefore, that computers and robots should be able to deliver the lessons that teachers can, including various ways of differentiating and presenting materials to suit varying abilities and ages of students.Where I am not convinced is in the pastoral role of teachers. Part of teaching is managing behaviour and showing empathy with students, so that they feel cared for and important. Even if a robot or computer can be programmed to imitate these actions, students will likely respond in a different way when they know an interaction is part of an algorithm rather than based on human emotion.Therefore, although I feel that computers should be able to perform a lot of the roles of teachers in the future, they should be used as educational tools to assist teachers and not to replace them. In this way, students would receive the benefits of both ways of instruction.
llm: The idea that computers and robots may take over the role of teachers due to the rise of artificial intelligence has ignited considerable discussion. While I acknowledge the concerns surrounding this topic, I largely disagree with the notion. To me, the responsibilities of a teacher go far beyond merely conveying information, which is the main area that AI can mimic.Primarily, teaching encompasses more than just sharing knowledge; it also involves nurturing, guiding, and mentoring students. Human teachers offer emotional support, empathy, and individualized attention, all of which are crucial for a student's comprehensive development. AI, regardless of its sophistication, lacks the emotional intelligence necessary to grasp the subtleties of human feelings and behavior. For example, a teacher can identify when a student is struggling not only academically but also personally, allowing them to provide appropriate support. This tailored approach cannot be matched by current AI technology.Moreover, education relies on intricate interactions like discussions, debates, and collaborative projects, all of which require human intuition, creativity, and critical thinking. Although AI can analyze vast data sets, it cannot replicate the depth and richness of human interactions. The learning journey is highly contextual, and human teachers are better suited to adjust their teaching strategies based on the needs and responses of their students.Additionally, human teachers play a significant role in fostering skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, and ethical decision-making. These abilities extend beyond simply processing information; they involve understanding the implications, questioning assumptions, and considering various perspectives. Such tasks demand a level of human judgment and experience that AI systems are not equipped to deliver.In summary, while artificial intelligence will certainly enhance education by offering personalized learning materials, streamlining administrative tasks, and providing real-time feedback, it is improbable that it will completely supplant human teachers. The core of teaching is rooted in human qualities—empathy, interaction, and the capacity to inspire and motivate—all of which set human educators apart. Therefore, the role of AI in education should be viewed as a means to support and enhance teachers’ capabilities rather than replace them.

question: Some people like to own the place where they live, but other people like to rent where they live. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The debate over whether it is better to own or rent the property in which one lives is one that has strong supporters on each side. There are persuasive arguments for both points of view.One of the main advantages of renting a property is flexibility. Usually, a tenant only has to give a month’s notice before changing where he or she lives. If a property is owned and a change is needed, the property must be put onto the market and it is frequently a long and stressful process to get a sale completed. Sometimes, the wrong time of year or a bad market can mean that a sale is not possible. Another advantage of renting is that a large amount of a family’s capital is not tied up in the property. Property can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars and often a lot more. If one rents, this money can be spent on other things to help improve the family’s quality of life. If the property is on a mortgage, then the deposit, also often very large, is tied up in the property and the pressure of having to make substantial payments every month can cause a lot of stress.Owning a property does have various advantages, though. Even though people usually have to service a mortgage every month with payments, this money is then built up with the property. With renting, the money is lost to the landlord, but at the end of the term of the mortgage, the whole property is owned by the family. This makes the process of living in a property a type of investment. In addition, the property’s value often goes up after time, frequently creating a substantial profit. Owning the property where one lives can also create a sense of well-being and self-actualisation.The decision to whether one rents or owns the property in which one lives really boils down to individual preference. My opinion is that it is much more preferable to own a property, mainly because it creates a valuable asset for the family.
llm: The discussion surrounding the choice between owning or renting a home has persisted for many years, with each option presenting its own set of pros and cons. On one hand, homeownership offers a feeling of stability and permanence, enabling individuals to establish roots and make substantial investments in their property. For example, homeowners have the freedom to make alterations and enhancements without needing permission from a landlord, granting them a sense of independence and authority over their living environment. Additionally, real estate can serve as a significant asset that may appreciate over time, potentially allowing for a financial cushion in the future.Conversely, renting provides a level of flexibility and freedom that allows people to relocate without being constrained to one place. Renters are not accountable for maintenance and repair expenses, which can sometimes impose a considerable financial burden. For instance, a renter can easily move to a new city for job opportunities or personal reasons without the hassle of selling a home or managing the complexities of remote property ownership. Furthermore, renting can be a more budget-friendly alternative, particularly for those who may not be prepared to commit to a long-term mortgage.In my view, renting is the more practical and appealing choice, especially for younger individuals or those who prioritize flexibility. Given the rising cost of living and the unpredictable job market, renting offers a degree of freedom and adaptability that often isn't available with owning a home. Additionally, the funds that would typically go toward a down payment and mortgage could be better utilized in other investments, such as a retirement account or a small business. However, for those who are ready to settle down and have a secure financial foundation, owning a property can indeed be a worthwhile and fulfilling investment. Ultimately, the decision to rent or own hinges on personal circumstances and priorities.

question: Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding changes. Others, however think that change is always a good thing. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: Nowadays, people are arguing whether an ideal lifestyle should be a stable one or should it include a wide ranges of changes.In my opinion, whether changes are needed should be determined the of you are at.Apparently, are favorable the development of young people, in to their careers. Primarily, an abundant experience in varieties of jobs enables the young to master a broad range of techniques and skills, leading to significant edge over counterparts in the competition for employment. Meanwhile, trying various roles in life and work provides wide of lifestyles for the young in the future. Only after this comparison can they realize what the real goals of their .However, other than frequent changes, the elderly who have undergone all these challenges may pursue a steady lifestyle. For the elders, concentration on their favorite activities would give rise to a sense of enjoyment and security, which is helpful to physical and psychological health. Due to a stable life, the elderly are less exposed to stress, leading to a decrease in adrenal hormones and resulting in their well-.Furthermore, degeneration of mental and physical function would make the elderly unlikely to adapt to external changes, causing and , which are not contributing to their health.Above all, it is unlikely to describe the changes in life with a positive or negative term. Accommodation for personal needs and goals is more important than the changes themselves.
llm: The discussion about the value of change in life has ignited passionate conversations among people. On one side, there are those who prefer to stick to a routine and resist change as it offers a sense of stability and security. This mindset allows them to establish a solid foundation and build on familiar practices, which helps minimize uncertainty and anxiety. For example, someone in a steady job might choose to remain in their current position because it ensures a reliable income and a clear understanding of their duties.Conversely, there are individuals who advocate for change as a positive force, believing that it brings fresh experiences, new opportunities, and fosters personal growth. Embracing change encourages people to leave their comfort zones, push their boundaries, and uncover new facets of their identities. It can also stimulate innovation, enhance problem-solving abilities, and broaden perspectives. For instance, traveling to different countries or pursuing a new hobby can introduce individuals to varied cultures, ideas, and ways of thinking, enriching their lives in the process.In my view, finding a balance between stability and change is crucial for a fulfilling life. While some level of routine and predictability is necessary for emotional and financial well-being, too much rigidity can lead to stagnation and monotony. On the other hand, relentless change can feel overwhelming and stressful. Thus, it’s important to find a middle ground that allows individuals to enjoy stability while also welcoming new experiences and challenges. By doing so, people can navigate life’s complexities with confidence, adaptability, and an eagerness to learn and grow. Ultimately, a balanced approach to change and stability is essential for leading a happy, engaging, and meaningful life.

question: Some people say education is the only critical factor to the development of a country. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: One the one hand good education is a highly recommended skill in the developed countries, on the other hand of many people in regions of poverty. But what makes education key factor for the development of a countryWe must acknowledge that education is something that we all need. The differences are just what we learn. Mostly the limited educational horizons of poor and less educated people have more to deal with their personal situation than with problems of bigger effects on a country. Attending school is sometimes too expensive and it does not feed a family.Nevertheless there must be a reason for education. For me it looks like some countries have realized that Education is the key for the globalization process. If we take India for example we can see that a change in the educational system had changed the economy of the country. country has changed from a poor region to a high potential for IT knowledge.In regard to this fact of education seriously and offer it to a wide range of people. Spending money education is the key tippy title=”for”]to[/tippy] a new future effects on the economy and social life. All in all I agree with the importance of education for the development of a country. Less knowledge leads to poverty and . Learning and Knowledge is Power and an investment in the near future and therefore it has to be an official task.
llm: The assertion that education is the sole critical factor in a country’s development is one that has ignited considerable debate among scholars and policymakers. Although education undeniably plays a pivotal role in national development, I fundamentally disagree with the idea that it is the only essential element.Education is, without a doubt, vital for promoting economic growth, social advancement, and political stability. A well-educated populace is better prepared to enter the workforce, foster innovation, and engage in informed decision-making. Education equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to participate effectively in the global economy, thereby propelling a nation's progress. Additionally, educated individuals are more likely to be active in the democratic process, contributing to a more informed and involved citizenry.However, many other factors are equally significant, if not more so, in shaping a country's development. For example, infrastructure, including roads, transportation systems, and communication networks, plays a crucial role in enabling trade, commerce, and the exchange of ideas. A stable and efficient political system, a strong healthcare system, and a conducive business environment are also vital aspects of a nation's development. Moreover, access to essential resources such as clean water, sanitation, and energy is crucial for the health and productivity of a nation's population.In summary, while education is indeed an important aspect of a country’s development, it is far from being the only critical factor. The development of a nation is a complex and multifaceted process that requires a combination of educated citizens, strong infrastructure, effective governance, and access to vital resources. Therefore, it's essential to adopt a comprehensive approach to development that acknowledges the interactions among these various elements, rather than viewing education as the sole engine of progress.

question: Some people say free time activities for children should be organized by parents. Others say that children should be free to choose what they do in their free time. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Whether parents should fully intervene in their children's organization of their leisure time or let them decide it, remains a big discussion. In this essay I will contrast the two opinions and I will explain why I think a good balance is needed.One of the reasons supporting the first view is the idea of the undeveloped children's ability to organize. This is because, although some of them might seem very mature for their age, others might struggle understanding the importance of having a routine, besides playing video games. For instance, many parents orientate their children helping them to organize hobbies and teaching a very important skill, time managment.On the other hand, some people encourage children to decide themselves what to do as this stimulates creativity and personal growth. This view, therefore, opens a new world for the little ones who can decide whatever they like, having multiple options. For example, children in this situation quite often are supported when they want to play sports or participate in a painting class.In my opinion, parents should not only be envolved as much as they can in all aspects of their children's lives, but also they might encourage the little ones to have personal opinions and decision about their hobbies and leisure actitivities. This may be a good way to build trust and communication between parents and children. Moreover, children learn responsability while being guided by their parents.In conclusion, some parents help their children more in scheduling their free time, while others intervene less leaving them to create a routine freely. I believe, parents should always be involved in their children's lives and decisions, allowing children participation too, which brings multiple benefits to their relationship.
llm: The discussion about how children ought to spend their leisure time has ignited a vigorous dialogue among parents and specialists. Some argue in favor of parents arranging activities for their children, asserting that such structure fosters a sense of security. Engaging in organized pursuits, like sports or music classes, not only helps children acquire valuable skills but also allows them to connect with their peers. This method can also guarantee that children are involved in safe, supervised environments, protecting them from potential dangers.Conversely, others contend that children should have the liberty to choose how they spend their free time, enabling them to pursue their interests and cultivate independence. Unstructured leisure time encourages creativity, decision-making, and learning from failures. It also offers them a chance to unwind and recharge, which is vital for their mental and physical health. An overly rigid schedule can lead to stress and burnout, which may diminish the advantages of extracurricular activities.In my view, it is essential to strike a balance between these two perspectives. While organized activities can have their benefits, allowing children the freedom to make choices and discover their passions is equally important. This approach can aid in developing their sense of responsibility, independence, and self-drive. Ultimately, parents must recognize the unique needs of their children and find a suitable compromise. By blending structure with freedom, parents can nurture their children into happy, confident, and well-rounded individuals.

question: Some people say that all popular TV entertainment programmes should aim to educate viewers about important social issues. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: It is often said that all influential TV entertainment programs should be geared towards raising people’s awareness about social issues that matter. While some TV programs could be suitable for this purpose, I disagree with the view that it should be mandatory for all of them, as the decision whether to do so must take into account the nature of the TV content and the channel’s audience.There is a large group of professionals who would benefit from deepening their understanding of what is happening in the world. Stock traders and bankers, for example, must always keep track of numerous business trends on a global scale, and they would appreciate this type of information on their favourite TV shows. Young people are another suitable audience due to the fact that they enjoy learning about popular topics from TV programmes. For instance, SDGs or the Sustainable Development Goals has now become an important topic to learn for children at school. Educational TV would provide a welcome alternative to textbooks, making learning more fun.Despite the potential advantages of incorporating educational content in TV programs, it is important to remember that the purpose of entertainment TV is for people to escape reality, to take a break from their hectic lives. Being reminded about some troubling social issues would not be appreciated by those who just want to unwind after a long day at work. Another consideration is how the content is perceived by the audience, because broadcasting serious topics as part of a comedy show might lead some viewers to believe they are of lesser significance. This would make TV shows of light-hearted nature a poor choice for inclusion of content on pressing social issues.In conclusion, entertainment TV programs can be an effective form of education for some people and a great tool to spread information. However, not all of them should be used for this purpose as there are various ways people appreciate them.
llm: The idea that popular television entertainment should focus on educating audiences about significant social issues has ignited a spirited discussion. While some believe these programs have a duty to inform and raise awareness, I only partially concur with this view.On one hand, the influence of popular TV shows on their viewers is substantial. With millions of people watching daily, these programs can shape public opinion and impact cultural norms. By integrating social issues into their narratives, they can highlight critical topics such as racism, sexism, and environmental challenges. This approach can foster a more informed and compassionate audience, which is crucial for building a fairer and more equitable society.On the other hand, the primary purpose of popular TV entertainment is to provide enjoyment, not education. Audiences tune in to unwind and have fun, not to receive lectures. If every show were to prioritize educating viewers about social issues, it could result in reduced viewership and diminished credibility. Additionally, other formats, like documentaries and news programs, are often more effective at delivering educational content regarding social issues.In summary, while I believe that popular TV entertainment can contribute to raising awareness about social issues, I do not consider it should be its main objective. A balance between entertainment and education is important, with shows addressing social issues in a manner that feels natural and respectful to their viewers. By achieving this balance, they can promote awareness without sacrificing their entertainment value.

question: Some people say that arts subjects are as essential as academic ones and should be part of school syllabus (agree/disagree)
human: Some people say that art subjects such as music, drama and creative writing are an essential part of education, and every school should include them in its syllabus. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your opinion and examples from your own experience.Art subjects such as music, drama and creative writing are fundamentals that enrich our lives. However, some parents say schools on teaching more academic subjects, such as mathematics, science, literature and history. In my opinion, both academic and arts subjects should be taught and I will expand on the pros and cons of including arts in the school program further on in this essay.On the one hand, academic subjects are often required when we get into higher . Academic subjects may be considered as in the academic world. Personally, I have never taken an entrance exam of art subjects for high school or university. In other words, schools measured my academic abilities using academic subjects, not art subjects. To suit the current educational system, many parents in my home country, Japan, send their children to cram schools to study academic subjects deeply.On the other hand, art subjects can strengthen the creativity and flexibility of individuals. Liberal arts, which include cultural understanding and knowledge, also include other arts subjects. In addition, we are living in the era of automation and artificial intelligence which are replacing human labor and office work more and more. In this regard, human creativity becomes more important. Therefore, art subjects are being more in demand to make a difference between individuals and computers.In conclusion, academic and arts subjects should blend in a school syllabus in a balanced way. Art subjects can also a better personality in individuals, so participation in these classes should be encouraged as well as academic achievements.The writer explored the reasons why including arts subjects in school syllabus is a good idea, while fluently expressing ideas and supporting them by examples. Correct paragraphing assists with orderly presentation of information, making this essay easy to follow; the range of vocabulary is quite wide. Accuracy of expression needs a bit more attention (see corrections underlined in blue), but overall, this essay could achieve IELTS Band 8.
llm: The significance of arts subjects in education has long been a subject of discussion. Some argue that they are less important than traditional academic subjects, but I strongly believe that they hold equal importance and should be included in the school curriculum. Subjects such as music, dance, and visual arts offer students a valuable outlet for creative expression and imaginative development.Integrating arts subjects into the educational framework can yield numerous advantages for students. For example, it can enhance their cognitive abilities, including memory and focus, as well as boost critical thinking skills. In addition, the arts can nurture creativity, bolster self-confidence, and encourage self-expression, all of which are vital life skills. Moreover, engaging with the arts allows students to discover their talents and interests, leading to a more enriched and purposeful life.Additionally, participation in arts programs can positively influence students' academic achievements. Studies indicate that students involved in the arts often excel in core subjects like math and reading. This improvement can be attributed to the development of important skills such as problem-solving, hand-eye coordination, and spatial awareness—abilities essential for academic success.In summary, I wholeheartedly believe that arts subjects are just as important as academic disciplines and must be integrated into the school curriculum. They offer a multitude of benefits, from enhancing cognitive skills to fostering creativity and individual expression. By prioritizing the arts in education, we can cultivate well-rounded, imaginative, and self-assured individuals ready to thrive in various aspects of life. Thus, it is crucial for schools to emphasize the importance of arts subjects and provide opportunities for students to explore their creative potential.

question: Some people say that modern technology has made shopping today easier, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: It is commonly argued that the fast pacing technology has helped people do shopping at the present time more easily. However, some people think online shopping is really difficult for them. This essay will consider both the advantages and disadvantages of the use of technology for shopping.One disadvantage of online shopping can be mentioned is that people cannot familiarize themselves with online applications for ordering essential goods and food. In fact, the elderly are not good at technology enough to go to virtual supermarkets. Besides, those who live in remote areas are not accessible easily to technology to buy online groceries.Despite its disadvantage, online shopping has brought about advantages for those who are technology natives. Firstly, it can be time-saving. In fact, shoppers can order any things they need with some clicks on the items, payment method, and time of delivery. Especially in a lingering Covid-19, when social distancing measures have been effective in some places in Viet Nam, according to a survey, the number of online shoppers has been increasing day by day, and thus many applications have been into existence, developed, and thrived.Another advantage of virtual shopping is that it can be life-saving to many people in a pandemic across nations. Going to supermarkets can be detrimental to buyers due to the spread of viruses and the higher risk of infection. For example, in order to buy bread for breakfast, people have to go out for it and thus may be exposed to infectious or incubated victims of Covid-19. Moreover, with preventive measures of Covid-19 containment, such as people not being allowed to go out for their essential goods, if they do not know how to make an online order, it is really difficult for them to survive during a pandemic.In conclusion, the use of technology for virtual shopping is beneficial to our time-saving and life-saving matters, though it is not familiar to some people. In my opinion, thanks to its advantages, I will continue to go shopping online, though the world has gone through the Covid-19 pandemic successfully.
llm: The introduction of modern technology has fundamentally changed how people shop, igniting discussions about its effects on the shopping experience. Supporters of this technological shift argue that shopping has become significantly easier. With the growth of e-commerce, consumers have the ability to browse and purchase items from the comfort of their own homes, around the clock. Online shopping platforms provide a vast selection of products, competitive pricing, and convenient delivery options, allowing individuals to shop without the need to physically visit stores. Moreover, mobile applications and digital payment systems have simplified the checkout process, cutting down on wait times and reducing reliance on cash and credit cards.Conversely, there are those who highlight the negative aspects of modern technology in the shopping realm. For example, online shopping can lead to disappointment when items don't match their online descriptions or when there are delays in delivery. Additionally, the absence of face-to-face interaction and personalized customer service can render online shopping a more impersonal and solitary experience. Some individuals also contend that the relentless flood of ads and promotions on social media and online platforms can be overwhelming, adding stress to the shopping process.In my view, modern technology has undeniably made shopping easier and more convenient. Despite certain drawbacks, the advantages of online shopping—such as flexibility, accessibility, and comfort—far outweigh the negatives. Moreover, many retailers are embracing technology to enhance in-store experiences, employing tools like augmented reality to allow customers to virtually try on products. All in all, modern technology has reshaped the shopping landscape, providing consumers with unprecedented choices, convenience, and flexibility.

question: Some people say that the Internet is making the world smaller by bringing people together. To what extent do you agree that the internet is making it easier for people to communicate with one another?
human: In today’s world due to the advancement of technology new inventions are coming into existence. It is true that ‘Necessity is a mother of invention’. Social media, email, and messaging applications enable interactions across various time zones and locations, making it possible for individuals to nurture relationships, form new friendships, and explore business opportunities internationally. The myriad advantages of online communication, including worldwide connectivity, information access, and collaborative opportunities, have made it an essential tool in contemporary life. As the internet continues to advance, its influence on global communication is poised to expand even further, creating an increasingly interconnected world.

question: Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?
human: There are a lot of research about development in human life, Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. After that, They will has a lot of complex relationship in school from friends and teachers that can infleuences children. So, Children should try to control yourself in moral to be a best quality adults.
llm: The discussion surrounding which stage of life exerts the greatest influence on an individual's future has ignited considerable debate. Some contend that the formative experiences a child encounters before entering school are pivotal, while others assert that the teenage years, particularly those spent in an educational setting, are more crucial. In this essay, I will explore both viewpoints and share my perspective.On one side, the early years of a child's life are essential in shaping their future trajectories. The experiences they have prior to beginning school, such as the nurturing environment at home and their relationships with family members, establish the groundwork for their social, emotional, and cognitive growth. For instance, children raised in a caring and supportive atmosphere are more likely to cultivate a robust sense of self-worth and confidence, which can have positive implications for their later life. Furthermore, studies indicate that early childhood experiences can significantly influence brain development, ultimately affecting a child's capacity to learn and achieve in school.Conversely, the experiences teenagers go through, especially in school, can also deeply affect their future lives. The adolescent years are marked by considerable physical, emotional, and social transformations, with experiences during this period playing a critical role in shaping one’s identity, values, and aspirations. For instance, a teenager encouraged to engage in extracurricular activities or sports may acquire vital life skills such as collaboration, discipline, and resilience. Moreover, the connections they form with peers and educators can significantly impact their academic achievements, career decisions, and overall well-being.In my view, both sides present valid arguments, and it is challenging to highlight a single life stage as the most influential. However, I believe that the experiences children have prior to school create a foundational base for future success, whereas the experiences encountered during the teenage years, particularly in educational settings, build upon this foundation and help define their specific paths in life. Ultimately, a combination of enriching early childhood experiences and a nurturing teenage environment can offer individuals the best possible beginnings.

question: Some people think history has nothing or little to tell us, but others think that studying the past history can help us better understand the present. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: With the development of technology, an increasing number of people try to acquire the latest technology such as computer programming, rather than to study history. There is a debate whether studying histroy could give us more advantages to understand the present society. In my opinion, obtaining knowledge of past history would be definitely helpful for us to live well in society today. I hold this opinion for two reasons, which I will elaborate on in the following essay.To begin with, looking back on history would give us the opportunity to notice mistakes which human beings used to make in the past. Specifically, all kinds of people and countries around the world had made innumerable mistakes throughout history. Besides, some of these mistakes might result in a huge number of victims. Therefore, human beings must avoid these tragedic events happening again. Above all, only knowing history could lead to avoidance of the recurrences. To be more specific, World War must be one of the serious events in human being history, and understanding of this truth have a significant impact on how we should live not to cause war again in the present society. It is manifest that leaning history is meaningful in this regard.On the other hand, some arguments can be made that old stories have little something to do with our present lives. However, closer examination would reveal that all the relationships present today originally come from something in the past. Knowing history enables us to find the best way to a fruitful future. The compelling example of this is racial discrimination in the U.S. Understanding the U.S. history could give us the best manner not to deteriorate relationships in the U.S. I suppose that studying history would be helpful for all human beings from this aspect.Having considered all the arguments above, learning history would be a major contributor to a better understanding of the present because we can know how to avoid the same mistake people used to made and how we should behave for the better result through history.
llm: The importance of studying history has sparked considerable debate, with some arguing that it holds little relevance in today's world, while others contend it is vital for understanding our current circumstances. Those who dismiss the significance of history often view it as merely a record of unchangeable past events. They argue that concentrating on history detracts from addressing urgent contemporary issues and future challenges. Additionally, they contend that historical context is frequently subjective and open to various interpretations, which undermines its reliability as a tool for comprehending the present.Conversely, many advocates for studying history argue that it is essential for comprehending the intricacies of modern life. History offers invaluable lessons on the evolution of societies, cultures, and governments, shedding light on the repercussions of past choices and actions. By analyzing historical events, we can uncover recurring patterns and causes that continue to influence today's world. For example, knowledge of past global conflicts can guide diplomatic initiatives and policy formulation, while insights from previous economic downturns can aid in averting future crises. Moreover, history serves to preserve cultural heritage and societal traditions, enriching our appreciation of diverse perspectives and experiences.In my view, studying history is crucial for making sense of the present. The past and present are deeply interconnected, as historical events and trends continue to shape current issues. Ignoring history risks repeating past errors and missing lessons from the achievements and failures of those who came before us. Thus, I assert that history has much to impart, and its examination should be promoted and valued as a means of navigating the complexities of today's world.

question: Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. llm: The discussion over whether cooking and food science should be part of school curricula has ignited passionate debate. They contend that by exploring nutrition, food safety, and meal preparation, students can gain essential life skills that will serve them well in the future. For example, a student skilled in cooking can make knowledgeable dietary choices, fostering a healthier lifestyle.Conversely, some believe that educational time should be focused on core subjects like mathematics, language, and science. They maintain that these subjects provide a robust foundation for future academic and career achievements. According to this perspective, time spent on cooking and food science could be more effectively allocated to core academic areas that are vital for intellectual growth. For instance, a student who excels in math and science may be better positioned to pursue careers in engineering or medicine.From my viewpoint, both perspectives have valid points, but I tend to support the inclusion of food science and cooking in the curriculum. Additionally, cooking can serve as a dynamic and enjoyable way to teach mathematical concepts like measurements and fractions, creating a valuable connection to academic learning. By integrating cooking and food science into education, teachers can offer students a well-rounded experience that equips them for a healthy, autonomous, and prosperous future.

question: Some people think that governments should ban dangerous sports, while others think people should have freedom to do any sports or activity. Discuss both views and give your own opinion
human: From the known history of the humanity, many sports or activities have been done to enjoy ourselfs, keeping in shape, or spent time. This point of view is not matching with the freedom. Yes, there might be a fee for tax payers, yet freedom should be above on all fees. Yet, they should not involve such things like banning sports since it is the preference of the people which dealing with the dangerous sports.
